programme.title: Ulica Patison
Leoforos Patision
programme.desc: Mama Yanniego chce wziąć udział w przesłuchaniu do roli szekspirowskiej Violi w "Wieczorze Trzech Króli". Będąc już w drodze, odkrywa, że jej synek został sam w domu. Kobieta wykonuje serię rozmów telefonicznych, aby nie stracić życiowej szansy zawodowej i jednocześnie nie zawieść w innej roli - tej najważniejszej. Cały czas porusza się po alei Patision, mającej zarówno w przeszłości, jak i teraźniejszości ogromne znaczenie dla każdego ateńczyka.

programme.title: L'ordre des médecins
Zawód: Lekarz
L'Ordre des médecins
programme.desc:
L'ordre des médecins: Directed by David Roux. With Jérémie Renier, Marthe Keller, Zita Hanrot, Maud Wyler. At the age of 37, Simon is a seasoned doctor, who works with death every day in his department of pneumology. As a good professional, he learned to protect himself. But when her mother is hospitalized in critical condition in a nearby service, the intimate and the professional telescope. All of Simon's world, all his certainties and beliefs are flickering." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8886110/","name":"L'ordre des médecins","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTVjOTVlNjktZWRjOS00MmQyLTgwYjgtZDUyZTQ2M2MwNDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the age of 37, Simon is a seasoned doctor, who works with death every day in his department of pneumology. As a good professional, he learned to protect himself. But when her mother is hospitalized in critical condition in a nearb","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8886110/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"My mummy is gonna die......","reviewBody":"If there is still any doubt that Mr Jérémie Rénier is one of the European 's greatest actors , see "l'Ordre Des Médecins ", a first effort by Mr David Roux , a masterstoke ;taking a subject as old as the hills (a mother dying in a hospital where his son is a seasoned lung specialist ) ,Roux avoids sentimentalism and pathos ,achieving a delicate balance between an almost documentary approach and an unusually human compassion ; many scenes come to mind : after the end (not shown on the screen) ,father and son desperately embrace each other in a dark room;the terminally-ill mom,saying her life has been a fullfilled one and that she can go;her last words spoken could be "all is well ,all is peace" ;the sequence when the whole family savors ice-creams in the garden echoes it ("isn't lemon taste wonderful,mom? and just have a taste of apricot") the young doctor, bursting into tears after saving a patient .

Jeremie Rénier,since his breakthrough with Ozon's disturbing "Les Amants Criminels" (1999),has proved he was able to play anything: from the last ,lonely and wretched guy ("L'Enfant" by the Dardenne bros ) to a pop singer ("Clo-Clo" )to self-assured lung specialist facing a situation which undermines the fondations of his world;a world which is not rosy every day : the scene in which Rénier took my breath away is when he scolds a young intern who has just said to a young patient suffering from mucovisdicosis that they would save her : and in spite of his ruthless words ,Rénier achieves the incredible feat of remaining endearing to the audience .

Matching him every step of the way is Marthe Keller's portrayal of a dying mother ;co-incidentally ,miss Keller had ,some forty years ago ,portrayed a terminally-ill woman opposite Al Pacino in "Bobby Deefield";she shows here that, unlike some her colleagues lost in the current "feel good" French scene,she can age gracefully.;spare of words and gestures ,she expresses everything with her looks.

But whereas the patient remains resigned to her fate, the husband does not accept it: "I'm fifteen years her senior,I should have gone first!" or " I 'd like best your mom to be in your service ,I'd be easier in my mind ";terse answer by the son: "it wouldn't make a difference".

And much to Roux' s credit ,no song in English ,as it is often the case with his "trendy " colleagues. Joe Dassin' s "C'Est La Vie Lily " provides the movie with one of his rare playful moments; "Donne-Moi La Main" is the equivalent of the poster ,the man with bright prospects who for the first time in his career needs a helping hand and who feels helpless and lonely in his tragedy .

Yes ,Mister Roux will be a name to be reckoned with,in the years to come.I would highly recommend this work,but only for people with a strong heart.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":245,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-01-23","keywords":"doctor,hospital,death,radiography,telephone call","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1026538009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc3ZjllMWYtOTFlZi00YTA2LWE2YjctZDI4ZmUwNjU5YWQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc3ZjllMWYtOTFlZi00YTA2LWE2YjctZDI4ZmUwNjU5YWQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753737/","name":"Jérémie Renier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445715/","name":"Marthe Keller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1581208/","name":"Zita Hanrot"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746196/","name":"David Roux"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0342973/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0482351/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0244390/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1701553/","name":"Julie Peyr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746196/","name":"David Roux"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Citizen Kitano: Directed by Yves Montmayeur. With Jacques Obadia, Gergana Muskalla, Laurent Lederer, Catherine Lairaud. programme.title: Na strajk!
programme.desc: Dzień z życia 19-letniego Karola, który opiekuje się dziadkiem chorym na alzheimera. Niebawem chłopak poznaje tajemnicę rodzinną związaną z dramatycznymi wydarzeniami podczas stoczniowych strajków w grudniu 1970 roku. Odkryta przeszłość zmusza go do podjęcia najważniejszej decyzji w życiu.

programme.title: Paul Newman: Błękitne oczy Hollywood
programme.desc: Bożyszcze światowego kina, Paul Newman, zasłynął licznymi kreacjami aktorskimi. Przeszedł do historii jako Butch Cassidy, nieugięty Luke, Rocky Graziano i Hud Bannon. Twórcy filmu przestawiają bogate dossier artysty, i to nie tylko aktorskie, ale też reżyserskie i producenckie. Poza tym opowiadają o życiu prywatnym Newmana. Pokazują go jako ojca, obywatela oraz pasjonata motoryzacji.

programme.desc: Alice et le maire: Directed by Nicolas Pariser. With Fabrice Luchini, Anaïs Demoustier, Nora Hamzawi, Léonie Simaga. The mayor of Lyon is in existential crisis. programme.title: Padrenostro
Padrenostro
programme.desc: Padrenostro: Directed by Claudio Noce. With Pierfrancesco Favino, Barbara Ronchi, Mattia Garaci, Francesco Gheghi. Two young boys, Valerio and Christian, form a powerful friendship over the summer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10798072/","name":"Padrenostro","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdjYWJlYTYtNzA0Zi00YTI2LWE2YmEtYmRlYTY0YjhkNjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQ4MDQ4ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two young boys, Valerio and Christian, form a powerful friendship over the summer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10798072/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mccollum26"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A lonely boy makes a friend, real or imaginary","reviewBody":"This is a story about a boy and his friendship with an older boy in the background of a family tragedy. However, the whole story is seen through the boy's eye, so the family's complex political intrigue nor the other boy's family situation aren't fully explained. We see the protagonist, Valerio brings food to someone hiding in the room full of junk, but it's empty as soon as his idyllic family set-up is shattered. When he first meets Christian, he appears out of nowhere, then disappears as soon as his mother calls him. Also when he ditches school with Christian, the school bullies let him go without a fuss. Is Christian imaginary? Or that's how Valerio remembers it. What I like about the most is how their friendship develops. Valerio(Mattia Garaci) and Christian(Francesco Gheghi) are two fresh faces with the latter has slightly more credit as he's little older too. They acted so well together, it's not hard to believe why Valerio desperately need him and vice versa. Since I'm not familiar with Italian cinema(this is my first Italian movie to be honest), Alfonso(Pierfrancesco Favino) is the only actor I'd recognize, but I will pay attention to the future endeavor from these two young talented actors. Valerio is a happy yet lonely boy needs a lot of growing up to do. Christian is a street-wise and confident, yet longing for the love of the family. Their friendship dynamic somewhat reminds me of "Let the right one in"(2008), a vulnerable and sensitive Oskar and confident yet mysterious Eli with a hidden agenda. Ending isn't quite clear and both grown-up boys don't seem to be happy nor successful. That's why this friendship real or imagenary that Valerio longed for must have helped him through out his life. Highly recommend!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":966,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-24","keywords":"in medias res,loss of father,terrorism,1980s,shooting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi374259993","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzljY2U1Y2ItMTEzMC00Zjk3LWExMTYtMDI3ODU5ZGYzODI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzljY2U1Y2ItMTEzMC00Zjk3LWExMTYtMDI3ODU5ZGYzODI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269419/","name":"Pierfrancesco Favino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4039652/","name":"Barbara Ronchi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10989630/","name":"Mattia Garaci"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2620255/","name":"Claudio Noce"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0492913/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0800679/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0800680/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3281211/","name":"Enrico Audenino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2620255/","name":"Claudio Noce"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 10798072, Title: Padrenostro, --- Description: Padrenostro: Directed by Claudio Noce. With Pierfrancesco Favino, Barbara Ronchi, Mattia Garaci, Francesco Gheghi. Two young boys, Valerio and Christian, form a powerful friendship over the summer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10798072/","name":"Padrenostro","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdjYWJlYTYtNzA0Zi00YTI2LWE2YmEtYmRlYTY0YjhkNjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQ4MDQ4ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two young boys, Valerio and Christian, form a powerful friendship over the summer.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10798072/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mccollum26","dateCreated":"2021-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A lonely boy makes a friend, real or imaginary","reviewBody":"This is a story about a boy and his friendship with an older boy in the background of a family tragedy. However, the whole story is seen through the boy's eye, so the family's complex political intrigue nor the other boy's family situation aren't fully explained. We see the protagonist, Valerio brings food to someone hiding in the room full of junk, but it's empty as soon as his idyllic family set-up is shattered. When he first meets Christian, he appears out of nowhere, then disappears as soon as his mother calls him. Also when he ditches school with Christian, the school bullies let him go without a fuss. Is Christian imaginary? Or that's how Valerio remembers it. What I like about the most is how their friendship develops. Valerio(Mattia Garaci) and Christian(Francesco Gheghi) are two fresh faces with the latter has slightly more credit as he's little older too. They acted so well together, it's not hard to believe why Valerio desperately need him and vice versa. Since I'm not familiar with Italian cinema(this is my first Italian movie to be honest), Alfonso(Pierfrancesco Favino) is the only actor I'd recognize, but I will pay attention to the future endeavor from these two young talented actors. Valerio is a happy yet lonely boy needs a lot of growing up to do. Christian is a street-wise and confident, yet longing for the love of the family. Their friendship dynamic somewhat reminds me of "Let the right one in"(2008), a vulnerable and sensitive Oskar and confident yet mysterious Eli with a hidden agenda. Ending isn't quite clear and both grown-up boys don't seem to be happy nor successful. That's why this friendship real or imagenary that Valerio longed for must have helped him through out his life. programme.desc: A Vigilante: Directed by Sarah Daggar-Nickson. With Olivia Wilde, Morgan Spector, Kyle Catlett, Estefania Tejeda. programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.title: Nowi mieszkańcy
Nachmieter
programme.desc: Rok 1945. Niemcy opuszczają Wrocław. Jedna z mieszkających pod miastem rodzin zmuszona jest zostać kilka miesięcy dłużej, niż zakładała. W jej domu zjawia się już jednak polska grupa krewnych. Obydwa klany mają poczucie krzywdy i wzajemnie są do siebie uprzedzone.

programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

programme.title: Mój kraj taki piękny
programme.desc: W Polsce trwa spór pomiędzy dwoma ugrupowaniami - narodowcami i ich przeciwnikami. Grzegorz Paprzycki dokumentuje przebieg tych potyczek. Pojawia się w samym środku wydarzeń, podczas których niejednokrotnie dochodzi do aktów przemocy. Film stanowi subiektywne spojrzenie na konflikt, który toczy się na polskich ulicach. Za swój obraz reżyser otrzymał Złotego Lajkonika na Krakowskim Festiwalu Filmowym.

programme.title: The Dressmaker
Garderobiany
The Dresser
programme.desc:
The Dressmaker: Directed by Jocelyn Moorhouse. With Kate Winslet, Judy Davis, Liam Hemsworth, Hugo Weaving. A glamorous woman returns to her small town in rural Australia. With her sewing machine and haute couture style, she transforms the women and exacts sweet revenge on those who did her wrong." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2910904/","name":"The Dressmaker","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4MzAxNTc5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjgzMDE4OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A glamorous woman returns to her small town in rural Australia. With her sewing machine and haute couture style, she transforms the women and exacts sweet revenge on those who did her wrong.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2910904/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mlaimlai2"},"dateCreated":"2015-11-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"All dressed up with somewhere to go!","reviewBody":"Over the years there have been many quirky, eccentric characters featured in Australian films such as Muriel's Wedding, The Castle and Priscilla Queen of the Desert. The stories have been uniquely Australian to be appreciated by Australian audiences but occasionally they become worldwide hits like Crocodile Dundee. It's the laid-back Aussie humour that international audiences sometimes just don't understand which prevents the majority of Australian films from crossing the cultural barrier. The Dressmaker has been successful at the Australian box office for it features a story where the underdog or misunderstood succeeds along with a story that promotes the Aussie dry wit with dialogue that appeals to the everyday Australian.

Myrtle 'Tilly' Dunnage (Kate Winslet) returns home to rural Australia after spending time abroad developing her fashion designing skills. As a child she was sent to a boarding school in Melbourne by Sergeant Farrat (Hugo Weaving) for she was accused of murdering a boy who bullied her. Her mother, Molly (Judy Davis) initially doesn't recognise her and isn't convinced she's her daughter. She eventually accepts her in her house and Tilly transforms it into a fashion factory where she makes clothes for the women of the town. In the meantime, she becomes romantically involved with Teddy McSwiney (Liam Hemsworth) whom she has known since they were children. The town still hasn't forgiven her for apparently killing the boy and believe she is cursed. Tilly will virtually stop at nothing to exact revenge on those who did her wrong. 

The Dressmaker is a long way from being perfect but what it does offer is an entertaining two hours that is well-paced and beguiling. There might be a few too many flashbacks and slow motion sequences but the compelling storyline featuring a wide range of interesting characters allows the majority of the film to shine. Some of the depictions of the characters might be broad but that's just the perfect fit for quintessential Australians. 

A lot of the dialogue is witty and adds much to the Aussie humour on show. Davis garners most of the laughs in a performance which demonstrates her sensational acting ability. Winslet perfects the Aussie accent with this being her second time playing an Australian after 1999's Holy Smoke! Many of the scenes she shares with her screen mother are hilarious. Weaving also has his turn in the spotlight with a wonderful performance as the cross-dressing police officer. Hemsworth plays it straight in comparison to his co-stars and reliably fulfills his role as the love interest. Support actors such as Shane Bourne, Sarah Snook, Kerry Fox and Barry Otto also succeed in projecting the individual traits of their characters.

Credit must go to the costume designs with the haute couture style befitting of the movie title. With the story being reminiscent of a Clint Eastwood western where the main character comes to town, mingles with the locals then affects their lives one way or another, the music score by David Hirschfelder has some resemblance to a western. It's an exciting score that perfectly sets up the moods of the characters and the theme of the plot. The cinematography by Donald McAlpine also enhances the look of the film, ensuring that the rural town maintains its 'western' appearance.

Although clichés do affect the characters and story, the overall quality of the film ensures that most viewers will be entertained. Jocelyn Moorhouse (the director and co-writer) should be chuffed with her film's box office success even though not all critics have praised her work. Sometimes it's the majority you have to please, not the minority. http://mlaimlai2.wix.com/magical-movie-review","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":57808,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-10-29","keywords":"f rated,australia,costume designer,haute couture,femme fatale","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Dressmaker trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2284565273","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzNjU0NTAyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTk1NjU3NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzNjU0NTAyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTk1NjU3NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Dressmaker trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001114/","name":"Judy Davis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2955013/","name":"Liam Hemsworth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0602104/","name":"Jocelyn Moorhouse"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0481969/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0263798/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5672426/","name":"Rosalie Ham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0602104/","name":"Jocelyn Moorhouse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Love in the Forecast

programme.title: Das Vorspiel
Przesłuchanie
Das Vorspiel
programme.desc:
Das Vorspiel: Directed by Ina Weisse. With Nina Hoss, Sophie Rois, Thorsten Merten, Franziska Fauth. Anna Bronsky is a violin teacher at the Conservatoire. Against the advice of her colleagues, she imposes the admission of a pupil, in whom she sees a great talent. With a lot of involvement, she prepares Alexander for the end-of-year exam and neglects her young son Jonas, who is also a violinist and ice hockey fan. She moves away more and more from her husband, so fond of him, the French "luthier" Philippe Bronsky. At the approach of audition, Anna pushes Alexander towards performances more and more exceptional. The decisive day, an accident occurs, heavy consequence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8620154/","name":"Das Vorspiel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjRkNDgzNmItYzAwZC00ZWE4LTliZjUtM2MyNGU2ODBhYjhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTQwMDA5NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Anna Bronsky is a violin teacher at the Conservatoire. Against the advice of her colleagues, she imposes the admission of a pupil, in whom she sees a great talent. With a lot of involvement, she prepares Alexander for the end-of-year","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8620154/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"danybur"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"When subtlety and intensity go hand in hand","reviewBody":"Summary

The film is a lesson in how marital and family problems (and of any kind) should not always be raised by screaming cinema or through marathon parliaments; of how crises coexist with everyday life. Nina Hoos (in another of her enormous performances) is one of those actresses who are ideal to also convey what is not said. Thanks to all that, her violin teacher and violinist is a more complex character than she initially seems.

Review:

Anna Bronsky (Nina Hoos) is a violin teacher at a music academy in Berlin. Against the opinion of other colleagues, she admits young Alexander (Ilja Monti, violinist in real life) as a student in order to prepare him for an audition. From this meeting, some changes will be triggered in Anna's personal environment and in herself.

The characters in Ina Weisse's film don't talk much; her actions, her gestures are explained by more. The skill and subtlety (and frankness) with which, through a few strokes, the situation of Anna's ties with her luthier husband, her pubescent son who also studies violin, her colleagues, her father and her student are remarkable; we see how the state of affairs also responds to other situations that are revealed and the way in which it does. That relationship with the violin appears as a teacher and as a performer "that she no longer plays" and the possibility of returning to this role. Alexander acts as a projection of the best of Anna and perhaps the worst as well; Not for nothing does the original German title (Das Vorspiel) mean prelude. Music as a discipline (sometimes cruel) clearly refers to discipline as a family history and as an eminently German topic and music as a means of relating to other people.

The film is a lesson in how marital and family problems (and of any kind) should not always be raised by screaming cinema or through marathon parliaments; of how crises coexist with everyday life.

Nina Hoos is one of those actresses who are ideal to also transmit what is not said; for them her Anna is a more complex character than she initially seems. On the other hand, it is remarkable the dry way with which Weisse cuts his scenes and correctly introduces the diegetic presence of classical music throughout the plot, a powerful resource that seems obvious in the cinema about musicians and music but that many times it is not well used.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":817,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2019-11-06","keywords":"f rated,title directed by female,triple f rated,female protagonist,violin","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Audition US Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2671361561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY1YWEzOTMtNTdkNi00YmUyLWEyZGMtMGQzOTJhNGI1NDI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY1YWEzOTMtNTdkNi00YmUyLWEyZGMtMGQzOTJhNGI1NDI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Audition US Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396125/","name":"Nina Hoss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294984/","name":"Sophie Rois"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0581536/","name":"Thorsten Merten"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919227/","name":"Ina Weisse"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034023/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0299039/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0332964/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1480840/","name":"Daphne Charizani"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919227/","name":"Ina Weisse"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wehikuł czasu - DeLorean
programme.desc: Uznawane obecnie za kultowe sportowe auto DeLorean DMC-12 zasłynęło jako pojazd służący do podróżowania w czasie w filmowej trylogii "Powrót do przyszłości". Twórcy dokumentu pokazują, jak zespół złożony z mechaników samochodowych i wielbicieli kina odtwarza - śrubka po śrubce - ten znany na całym świecie samochód, którym Marty McFly przenosił się z dekady w dekadę.

programme.title: The Bedroom Window
Widok z sypialni
The Bedroom Window
programme.desc: The Bedroom Window: Directed by Curtis Hanson. With Steve Guttenberg, Elizabeth McGovern, Isabelle Huppert, Paul Shenar. A young executive starts an affair with his boss's wife which then escalates into a nightmare after he lies to the police in order to protect her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0092627/","name":"The Bedroom Window","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQ4OWUxN2UtNTVhMy00Y2E3LTk0NTYtMjRiNzZjYjc1OTUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young executive starts an affair with his boss's wife which then escalates into a nightmare after he lies to the police in order to protect her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0092627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Greensleeves"},"dateCreated":"2007-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't take it too seriously - just enjoy!","reviewBody":"This thriller would have made a great Hitchcock movie. As it stands, it's not too bad but it could have been so much better. However, any film that can engage the attention for nearly two hours must have something going for it and this does have an intriguing story line. It also has the advantage of a good cast, Steve Guttenberg is his usual affable self doing the wrong thing for the right reasons, Elizabeth McGovern brings a wonderful hard edge to her performance and Isabelle Huppert is beautiful but nasty. Brad Greenquist manages to imbue his role with a sinister quality without saying barely a word. The plot doesn't really hold up unfortunately and there are plenty of scenes that stretch credulity just too far. However if you are prepared to accept the film on just a surface level you will find yourself nicely entertained.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5568,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1987-01-16","keywords":"rape,neo noir,revenge,rape victim,hitchcockian","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi244564761","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzAzOWYxNDYtY2M2Zi00YzMxLWIxNDItNmJiNjMyMDlkM2E1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzAzOWYxNDYtY2M2Zi00YzMxLWIxNDItNmJiNjMyMDlkM2E1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"A young executive starts an affair with his boss's wife which then escalates into a nightmare after he lies to the police in order to protect her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000430/","name":"Steve Guttenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001527/","name":"Elizabeth McGovern"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000436/","name":"Curtis Hanson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046277/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0390159/","name":"Anne Holden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000436/","name":"Curtis Hanson"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0092627, Title: The Bedroom Window, --- Description: The Bedroom Window: Directed by Curtis Hanson. With Steve Guttenberg, Elizabeth McGovern, Isabelle Huppert, Paul Shenar. A young executive starts an affair with his boss's wife which then escalates into a nightmare after he lies to the police in order to protect her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0092627/","name":"The Bedroom Window","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQ4OWUxN2UtNTVhMy00Y2E3LTk0NTYtMjRiNzZjYjc1OTUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young executive starts an affair with his boss's wife which then escalates into a nightmare after he lies to the police in order to protect her.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0092627/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Greensleeves","dateCreated":"2007-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't take it too seriously - just enjoy!","reviewBody":"This thriller would have made a great Hitchcock movie. As it stands, it's not too bad but it could have been so much better. However, any film that can engage the attention for nearly two hours must have something going for it and this does have an intriguing story line. It also has the advantage of a good cast, Steve Guttenberg is his usual affable self doing the wrong thing for the right reasons, Elizabeth McGovern brings a wonderful hard edge to her performance and Isabelle Huppert is beautiful but nasty. Brad Greenquist manages to imbue his role with a sinister quality without saying barely a word. The plot doesn't really hold up unfortunately and there are plenty of scenes that stretch credulity just too far. However if you are prepared to accept the film on just a surface level you will find yourself nicely entertained.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5568,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1987-01-16","keywords":"rape,neo noir,revenge,rape victim,hitchcockian","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi244564761","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzAzOWYxNDYtY2M2Zi00YzMxLWIxNDItNmJiNjMyMDlkM2E1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzAzOWYxNDYtY2M2Zi00YzMxLWIxNDItNmJiNjMyMDlkM2E1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"A young executive starts an affair with his boss's wife which then escalates into a nightmare after he lies to the police in order to protect her.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000430/","name":"Steve Guttenberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001527/","name":"Elizabeth McGovern","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000436/","name":"Curtis Hanson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046277/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0390159/","name":"Anne Holden","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000436/","name":"Curtis Hanson"],"duration":"PT1H52M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Corporate Animals
Korpoludki
Corporate Animals
programme.desc:
Corporate Animals: Directed by Patrick Brice. With Demi Moore, Jessica Williams, Ed Helms, Karan Soni. CEO Lucy takes her staff on corporate team building in some underground desert caves in New Mexico. They get stuck there." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8366502/","name":"Corporate Animals","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGI4NDhmMTUtNTcwMC00OTY3LWIyYTItYWM5ZjNkZGM2ZjQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"CEO Lucy takes her staff on corporate team building in some underground desert caves in New Mexico. They get stuck there.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8366502/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"something to chew on","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Filmmaker Patrick Brice is building a career on films that leave us with an unsettled, even conflicted feeling on whether we should "like" them or not. He certainly has little time for 'normal' characters, and heroic behavior rarely enters a scene. His latest is written by Sam Bain (PEEP SHOW, and son of Emmy winning director Bill Bain), and it fits perfectly into the offbeat comedy realm of Mr. Brice's previous two CREEP films (with Mark Duplass) and THE OVERNIGHT (2015).

The film kicks off was an advertisement (in the pre-production stage) for Incredible Edibles, a bio-friendly company that produces edible cutlery (a comical visual). Featured in the ad is the company's ruthless CEO Lucy, played by Demi Moore. Lucy has arranged a Team Building outing for her employees in the mountains of New Mexico. The expedition is led by Brandon (Ed Helms, THE HANGOVER), a Bear Gryllis type who easily evaluates the team's incongruent pieces. After advising against Lucy's demand for the "Advanced" trail, Brandon gives in since 'the check has cleared'. He proceeds to lead the team on a repelling adventure down into a stunning cavern.

Just when it looks like the "advanced" trail was the right call, a cave-in occurs, trapping the team with no escape route, and little food or water. It's at this point when we realize that most of Lucy's management style seems to have originated in a 'get tough' management book from the 1960's. She has no real instinct on how to treat people, and mostly just bullies and tricks them. Ms. Moore's character and performance could easily be viewed as a spoof of her DISCLOSURE role with some uncomfortable laughs. We even get a Harvey Weinstein punchline.

Noticeable right away is the terrific comedic cast. Lucy's team consists of Jess (Jessica Williams, BOOKSMART), Freddie (Karan Soni, DEADPOOL), Derek (Isiah Whitlock Jr, CEDAR RAPIDS), Gloria (Martha Kelly, "Baskets"), Billy (Dan Bakkedahl, SWORD OF TRUST), May (Jennifer Kim, "The Blacklist"), Suzy (Nasim Padrad, ALADDIN), and intern Aidan (Calum Worthy, "American Vandal"). This is an exceptionally talented group of funny people who know how to deliver a line. Some of the funniest moments are the 'throwaway' lines being uttered in between the main dialogue. That's where the real comedy gold is buried, so listen closely.

Although the film is a comedy, it also boasts some elements of horror and suspense. Lucy's twisted idealism is the basis for some of this, as is the team's situation as things become more dire (think ALIVE blended with any workplace comedy). We learn the company is teetering on financial failure, and as one might expect in a confined area, workplace resentments and true feelings begin to rear up. The script never quite takes on business satire, focusing instead on personal reactions to a bleak situation. Even Gary Sinise and Britney Spears are included in the comic elements, and while some will find this to be a fitting midnight movie, others will once again be left wondering what to make of Patrick Brice's films. And maybe that's the point.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3169,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2019-09-20","keywords":"male frontal nudity,male nudity,male full frontal nudity,pubic hair,male pubic hair","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3595353113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhiODdlMzMtY2Q1ZC00MTAyLTkxYzMtYTFhYmE5MTBlMGE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhiODdlMzMtY2Q1ZC00MTAyLTkxYzMtYTFhYmE5MTBlMGE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lucy (Demi Moore) is the egotistical megalomaniac CEO of Incredible Edibles, America's premier provider of edible cutlery. In her infinite wisdom, Lucy leads her staff including her long-suffering assistants, Freddie (Karan Soni) and Jess (Jessica Williams), on a corporate team-building caving weekend to New Mexico. When disaster strikes, not even their useless guide, Brandon (Ed Helms), can save them. Trapped underground by a cave-in, this mismatched and disgruntled group must pull together in order to survive."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000193/","name":"Demi Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1790970/","name":"Jessica Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159180/","name":"Ed Helms"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2674307/","name":"Patrick Brice"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0447391/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0228888/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0188303/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1095060/","name":"Sam Bain"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La chute de l'empire américain
Upadek amerykańskiego imperium
La chute de l'empire américain
programme.desc:
La chute de l'empire américain: Directed by Denys Arcand. With Alexandre Landry, Maripier Morin, Rémy Girard, Louis Morissette. A shy and insecure delivery truck driver accidentally arrives on the scene of a major crime and picks up two bags of cash and hides them. Only the help of a prostitute and a former biker released from jail might get him out of trouble." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7231342/","name":"La chute de l'empire américain","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRjODBiYmMtYTMyMC00OWFkLWIxOWYtYmMzOTczZDVjMTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY0Mzg3MTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A shy and insecure delivery truck driver accidentally arrives on the scene of a major crime and picks up two bags of cash and hides them. Only the help of a prostitute and a former biker released from jail might get him out of troubl","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7231342/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"stealing from criminals","reviewBody":"French-Canadian filmmaker Denys Arcand won the Best Foreign Language Oscar for THE BARBARIAN INVASIONS (2003), and has gained a very loyal group of followers for his films. It should be noted that, despite the title, this is not a sequel or prequel to Arcand's 1986 film THE DECLINE OF THE AMERICAN EMPIRE. This one is a comedy-crime drama that is as cynical as it is witty, and perhaps as much social commentary as satire. It's yet another rip on capitalism while showing that idealism can work wonders (at least if it's well funded). "Intelligence is a handicap." That's what Pierre-Paul Daoust (played by Alexandre Landry) tells his girlfriend as he breaks up with her in a café. When she points out that he's a delivery driver (similar to UPS), Pierre-Paul riffs on a number of famous writers and philosophers who he claims were dumb as rocks. Her inquiry into Trump being elected President leads to his conclusion, "imbeciles worship cretins". He is the kind of guy that has an answer for everything, and possesses a type of oratory expertise that makes his excuses sound like scientific explanations.

One day while on his route, he stumbles into a robbery gone way wrong. Two thieves were in the process of stealing gang/mob money (and lots of it) when a shooting broke out. In the immediate aftermath, Pierre-Paul makes the snap decision to toss the two huge bags of cash into the back of his deliver truck and take off. This kicks off a chain of events that includes his crossing paths with Aspasie/Camille (Maripier Morin) a high dollar escort whose website features a quote from "Racine". Pierre-Paul is a Ph.D. in Philosophy, so he takes this as a sign.

Shortly after, Pierre-Paul is meeting with Sylvain "the brain" (Arcand regular Remy Girard), a recently released from prison biker who has become an expert on money laundering. The three form an odd partnership and are followed wherever they go by a couple of police detectives. Camille introduces Sylvain and Pierre-Paul to Mr. Taschereau (Pierre Curzi), her dapper former lover who also happens to be the foremost authority on international tax evasion and high finance.

The running joke here is that Pierre-Paul is an upright citizen who has never done anything remotely illegal in his life. In fact, he regularly doles out money to Quebec's homeless and those down on their luck. He also volunteers regularly at a shelter that feeds those in need. The obvious statement here is pointing out the great divide between the wealthy and the poor.

Arcand's film is close to being very good, but falls short in too many areas to reach the height it desires. There is a torture scene that seems totally out of place compared to the tone of the rest of the film, and I refuse to make the link to PRETTY WOMAN - another film where the rich guy wins over the good-hearted sex worker. This film talks about "providence" and just rewards that rarely happen. Is it acceptable to do the wrong thing for the right reasons? Does doing good correct a wrong? Heck, is it even wrong to steal from criminals? What the film actually does is serve up obvious targets with no real solutions offered. The self-congratulatory ending with close-up shots of Quebec's homeless doesn't help.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3469,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-06-28","keywords":"high heels,bag of money,delivery truck,escort girl,stealing from the mob","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1246018073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTdlOTgyYTUtMWQxZS00ZjFlLTg2NWMtZWY5NjI3N2FmNDRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTdlOTgyYTUtMWQxZS00ZjFlLTg2NWMtZWY5NjI3N2FmNDRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pierre-Paul Daoust, 36, an intellectual with a PhD in philosophy is forced to work as a deliveryman to afford a decent living. One day, while delivering a parcel, he gets caught in a hold up gone terribly wrong: two dead and millions in money bags laying on the ground. Pierre-Paul is confronted with a dilemma leave empty handed, or take the money and run?"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5861077/","name":"Alexandre Landry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4490302/","name":"Maripier Morin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320721/","name":"Rémy Girard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000780/","name":"Denys Arcand"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0021150/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053578/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0299307/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000780/","name":"Denys Arcand"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hard Ground
Bezlitosna ziemia
Hard Ground
programme.desc: Hard Ground: Directed by Frank Q. Dobbs. With Burt Reynolds, Bruce Dern, Amy Jo Johnson, Seth Peterson. Billy Bucklin escapes while being transported to Yuma prison and plans to form an army of desperadoes to control the Mexican border. To finance his band, he robs a stagecoach, kidnaps a beautiful woman to be sold into prostitution, and steals an army payroll wagon. An aging lawman persuades the governor to parole his brother-in-law, now serving a 20-year prison term for murder, to assist him and his green deputy to destroy the marauders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0349529/","name":"Hard Ground","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc3YzJhY2QtNTVlNC00MTQyLTgwYTAtYTU1NzEwNTY2YmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Billy Bucklin escapes while being transported to Yuma prison and plans to form an army of desperadoes to control the Mexican border. To finance his band, he robs a stagecoach, kidnaps a beautiful woman to be sold into prostitution, a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0349529/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Wizard-8"},"dateCreated":"2010-11-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Mostly flat","reviewBody":"If you are familiar with the movies that Hallmark Entertainment makes and/or distributes, you can probably guess that this particular movie misses the mark. To be fair, not everything about the movie is bad. It's always nice to see Burt Reynolds or Bruce Dern, and we get them both in the movie. They give the movie some charm and they have some good chemistry together. But not much else in the movie works. The feel of the movie is not right, from the unauthentic-looking props to the real generic locations. The bad guys in the movie are surprisingly boring, and they don't do much more than shoot people while chortling. The biggest flaw in the movie is that the movie is very uneventful, moving at a very slow pace. It feels like a half hour TV western stretched to 88 minutes. Let this one ride by."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"genre":["Western"],"datePublished":"2003-07-12","keywords":"apache indian,arizona territory,yuma arizona,yuma territorial prison,territorial prison","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000608/","name":"Burt Reynolds"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001136/","name":"Bruce Dern"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005057/","name":"Amy Jo Johnson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0229638/","name":"Frank Q. programme.title: Remember Me
Twój na zawsze
Remember Me
programme.desc:
Remember Me: Directed by Allen Coulter. With Caitlyn Rund, Moisés Acevedo, Noel Rodriguez, Kevin P. McCarthy. A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1403981/","name":"Remember Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTA4MTg1ODkwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzE5ODAxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1403981/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Southerngiftsu"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Same movie as pro critics?","reviewBody":"I walked away from the movie, Remember Me, asking myself one question. Did I just see the same movie I have heard several professional movie critics review negatively or indifferently? The first review I read online for Remember Me was that it was trite, predictable, and drawn out. (Bull, I say.) The responses of those around me in the theater today proved those claims false as well. I saw people laughing, gasping, wincing, and weeping. I saw the audience RELATING.

The characters are multi-dimensional and the acting is fantastic. This movie was not just feel-good fluff. It was not a platform to showcase Brosnan and Pattinson as eye candy. It was thought-provoking and intense. The characters were brooding, wounded, lovable and believable. The movie's twist was unique and effective.

If you want to see an enjoyable movie that will challenge your emotions and leave you feeling appropriately introspective, Remember Me fits the bills perfectly. (And there is nothing at all wrong with the added eye-candy benefit! ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":142953,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-03-31","keywords":"new york,new york city,binge drinking,september 11 2001,year 1991","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1472839961","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGJlMTgxMGMtZWE5NC00NjA1LWEzNTgtMmVhZGZjNTY0MzNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGJlMTgxMGMtZWE5NC00NjA1LWEzNTgtMmVhZGZjNTY0MzNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500155/","name":"Robert Pattinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211087/","name":"Emilie de Ravin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3533310/","name":"Caitlyn Rund"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002339/","name":"Allen Coulter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3391497/","name":"Will Fetters"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Twin Daggers
Shuang Biao
programme.desc: Twin Daggers: Directed by Kun-Hou Chen. With Rhett Giles, Coco Su, Veronica Bero, Joey Covington. A famous L.A. hitman falls in love with his target." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1266149/","name":"Twin Daggers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk0MDU4NDE2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzE3MjA2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A famous L.A. hitman falls in love with his target.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1266149/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gridoon2021"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Plot > action","reviewBody":"Usually in martial arts films, there is a weak plot supporting strong fight scenes; in "Twin Daggers", it's the other way around. The fight scenes, although they have their moments here and there, are spoiled by too many gimmicks, MATRIX ripoffs, freeze frames, speeding up, silly wirework, stunt doubling, etc. The characters themselves are colorful enough (especially "The Body", a bodacious female assassin with blades hidden in her boots, and "The Ghost", a sort of trickster/clown who prefers laughing to talking), but they are poorly served by the film's action sequences. What works much better is the plot, which manages to stay ahead of the viewer all the way and contains several surprising twists. There is perhaps one instance of cheating, but only if you can't accept the possibility that two events shown in parallel time don't necessarily have to be happening at the same time. This surprising script was deserving of better choreography, editing and production values in general. ** out of 4.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":296,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2008-07-22","keywords":"hitman,violence,martial arts","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065316/","name":"Rhett Giles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3080460/","name":"Coco Su"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157242/","name":"Veronica Bero"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155292/","name":"Kun-Hou Chen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078389/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065443/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0139852/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11888805/","name":"Allen Shan"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

A famous L.A. hitman falls in love with his target." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1266149/","name":"Twin Daggers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk0MDU4NDE2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzE3MjA2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A famous L.A. hitman falls in love with his target.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1266149/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"gridoon2021","dateCreated":"2009-03-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Plot > action","reviewBody":"Usually in martial arts films, there is a weak plot supporting strong fight scenes; in "Twin Daggers", it's the other way around. The fight scenes, although they have their moments here and there, are spoiled by too many gimmicks, MATRIX ripoffs, freeze frames, speeding up, silly wirework, stunt doubling, etc. The characters themselves are colorful enough (especially "The Body", a bodacious female assassin with blades hidden in her boots, and "The Ghost", a sort of trickster/clown who prefers laughing to talking), but they are poorly served by the film's action sequences. What works much better is the plot, which manages to stay ahead of the viewer all the way and contains several surprising twists. There is perhaps one instance of cheating, but only if you can't accept the possibility that two events shown in parallel time don't necessarily have to be happening at the same time. This surprising script was deserving of better choreography, editing and production values in general. ** out of 4.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":296,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2008-07-22","keywords":"hitman,violence,martial arts","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065316/","name":"Rhett Giles","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3080460/","name":"Coco Su","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157242/","name":"Veronica Bero"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155292/","name":"Kun-Hou Chen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078389/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065443/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0139852/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11888805/","name":"Allen Shan"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Double Dragon
Znak Smoka
Double Dragon
programme.desc:
Double Dragon: Directed by James Yukich. With Robert Patrick, Mark Dacascos, Scott Wolf, Kristina Wagner. Two brothers have half of a powerful ancient Chinese talisman. An evil gang leader has the other half, and determines to get the brothers' half and have a complete medallion so he can gain absolute power." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0106761/","name":"Double Dragon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGZjNGUyMmEtNDIwYy00NWVjLTk4YzUtYTRiYjBhZDQ0ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two brothers have half of a powerful ancient Chinese talisman. An evil gang leader has the other half, and determines to get the brothers' half and have a complete medallion so he can gain absolute power.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0106761/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Skeletors_Hood"},"dateCreated":"2002-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's cheesy, but remember, cheese is good too.","reviewBody":"Ok, it's not an Oscar winner, but few films are. It is a campy flick, but it's not the wanna-poke-your-eyes-out-to-stop-the-pain campy, but rather in the realm of a guilty pleasure.

In agreement with an earlier post, this was not supposed to be a film that took itself seriously. Notably, the action was on par with any other martial arts movie being made, and the script had a bunch of smart-assy humor (which I must admit that I'm a big sucker for). It's meant to be a fun film, and that was the end result.

As far as a video game movie is concerned, it's not the worst ever made...Mario Bros is still the king, with Street Fighter in a close second, and Final Fantasy in third place. So you see, there are worst movies that have been made.

And folks, I'm not ashamed to admit that I have the DVD for this film in my collection."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13118,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1994-11-04","keywords":"teenage girl,vigilante,medallion,martial arts,shadow","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Double Dragon","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1772290329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTE4Yzc4NDQtNWU5OS00ZWNhLWE5ZWEtZDEzNWQ5MTE1YjFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTE4Yzc4NDQtNWU5OS00ZWNhLWE5ZWEtZDEzNWQ5MTE1YjFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"text on screen"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001598/","name":"Robert Patrick"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001092/","name":"Mark Dacascos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937930/","name":"Scott Wolf"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0950819/","name":"James Yukich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035964/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013199/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033186/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0227704/","name":"Paul Dini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0795990/","name":"Neal Shusterman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0205157/","name":"Michael Davis"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pineapple Express
Boski chillout
Pineapple Express
programme.desc:
Pineapple Express: Directed by David Gordon Green. With Seth Rogen, James Franco, Danny McBride, Kevin Corrigan. A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0910936/","name":"Pineapple Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1MTE4NzAwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzg3Mjg2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0910936/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2009-01-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Laughs","reviewBody":"Pineapple Express (2008) 

*** (out of 4) 

A pothead (Seth Rogan) and his dimwitted dealer (James Franco) hit the road after witnessing a cop (Rosie Perez) murder a man. Pretty soon the two are trying to get away from the cop as well as two drug lords in the middle of a war. As far as pot comedies goes this one here is nearly the best the small genre has to offer. I'm sure Cheech and Chong would give this thing two bongs up as it does contain plenty of laughs but I couldn't help but feel it had the same shortcomings as other Judd Apatow movies. That one issue with this film, as well as the others, is that it runs too long for its own good. Clocking in a nearly two-hours I couldn't help but feel that the film could have lost thirty-minutes and not much would have been missed. This is especially true during the ending shoot out, which just keeps going and going. Outside of that issue this film contains some great big laughs with most of them coming in the form of pot jokes and stuff dealing with stoners. Seth Rogan turns in another winning performance as he gains plenty of laughs from his older guy. James Franco is the real jewel in the film as he's dead-on perfect as the drug dealing loser who just sits around his house getting high, selling pot and watching reruns on television. Franco gets the look down just right but his facial gestures and voice tone perfectly capture that pot head many of us have met in our lives. I thought Perez was pretty much wasted in a thankless role that didn't offer her too much to do. Ed Begley, Jr. has a funny bit as Rogan's girlfriend's father. The screenplay really doesn't offer us any jokes we haven't seen countless times before and in many ways there's not an original idea here but that doesn't really matter because the performances are what makes the movie funny."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":327808,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2008-08-06","keywords":"stoner,falling downhill,watching tv,man tied up,handcuffed man","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pineapple Express: Theatrical trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2729574681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTY4NzYxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3NDEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTY4NzYxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3NDEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for David Gordon Green's Pineapple Express."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0170550/","name":"Gary Cole"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0337773/","name":"David Gordon Green"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1698571/","name":"Evan Goldberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

Air America
programme.desc:
Air America: Directed by Roger Spottiswoode. With Mel Gibson, Robert Downey Jr., Nancy Travis, Ken Jenkins. A young pilot finds himself recruited unwittingly into a covert and corrupt C.I.A. airlift organization operating in Vietnam War-era Laos." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0099005/","name":"Air America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDRiNzdlYzUtNzIxMy00OGI4LThlNjQtNTI3Njg5NjVlOWJkL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQzNDI3NzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young pilot finds himself recruited unwittingly into a covert and corrupt C.I.A. airlift organization operating in Vietnam War-era Laos.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099005/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Howlin Wolf"},"dateCreated":"2001-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"An interesting little film...","reviewBody":"... because, whilst it doesn't have anything overly outstanding about it, it manages to be very entertaining. Perhaps it's just because the pairing of Gibson and Downey, Jr. appeals to me. Whatever it is, I found the setup interesting, the comedy funny and the action nicely staged.

I'm tempted to say that its lukewarm reception was down to poor marketing, but I'm not sure that's true. Maybe I just have to accept that I quite like a movie that the majority think is bad.

I don't know what it is with Gibson and 'non-Lethal-Weapon' action comedies, but "Bird on a Wire" seems to be regarded as another commercial failure, and I enjoyed that one too. Time to take me off to the funny farm... ?","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":28162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"1990-08-10","keywords":"cia,pilot,laos,vietnam war,black comedy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2458764057","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQ3MTUxZWQtNjI1My00ZmY0LWIxODQtNDVlNjRhNmYxNjdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQ3MTUxZWQtNjI1My00ZmY0LWIxODQtNDVlNjRhNmYxNjdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young pilot finds himself recruited unwittingly into a covert and corrupt C.I.A. airlift organization operating in Vietnam War-era Laos."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000375/","name":"Robert Downey Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001802/","name":"Nancy Travis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006854/","name":"Roger Spottiswoode"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094459/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0149490/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730313/","name":"Christopher Robbins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260675/","name":"John Eskow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0750701/","name":"Richard Rush"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0099005, Title: Air America, --- Description: Air America: Directed by Roger Spottiswoode. With Mel Gibson, Robert Downey Jr., Nancy Travis, Ken Jenkins. A young pilot finds himself recruited unwittingly into a covert and corrupt C.I.A. airlift organization operating in Vietnam War-era Laos." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0099005/","name":"Air America","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDRiNzdlYzUtNzIxMy00OGI4LThlNjQtNTI3Njg5NjVlOWJkL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQzNDI3NzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young pilot finds himself recruited unwittingly into a covert and corrupt C.I.A. airlift organization operating in Vietnam War-era Laos.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099005/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Howlin Wolf","dateCreated":"2001-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"An interesting little film...","reviewBody":"... because, whilst it doesn't have anything overly outstanding about it, it manages to be very entertaining. Perhaps it's just because the pairing of Gibson and Downey, Jr. appeals to me. Whatever it is, I found the setup interesting, the comedy funny and the action nicely staged.

I'm tempted to say that its lukewarm reception was down to poor marketing, but I'm not sure that's true. Maybe I just have to accept that I quite like a movie that the majority think is bad.

I don't know what it is with Gibson and 'non-Lethal-Weapon' action comedies, but "Bird on a Wire" seems to be regarded as another commercial failure, and I enjoyed that one too. Time to take me off to the funny farm... ?","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":28162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"1990-08-10","keywords":"cia,pilot,laos,vietnam war,black comedy","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2458764057","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQ3MTUxZWQtNjI1My00ZmY0LWIxODQtNDVlNjRhNmYxNjdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQ3MTUxZWQtNjI1My00ZmY0LWIxODQtNDVlNjRhNmYxNjdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young pilot finds himself recruited unwittingly into a covert and corrupt C.I.A. airlift organization operating in Vietnam War-era Laos.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000375/","name":"Robert Downey Jr.","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001802/","name":"Nancy Travis"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006854/","name":"Roger Spottiswoode"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094459/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0149490/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730313/","name":"Christopher Robbins","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260675/","name":"John Eskow","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0750701/","name":"Richard Rush"],"duration":"PT1H53M"</script><metacontent="

Many other people complain that its to slow because nothing happens in the beginning, hate to break it to you but thats called developing the characters, something that a lot of horror movies lack. This movie is really good, really scary, and one of the few horror movies that is actually re-watchable. programme.title: Single White Female
Sublokatorka
Single White Female
programme.desc:
Single White Female: Directed by Barbet Schroeder. With Bridget Fonda, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Steven Weber, Peter Friedman. A woman advertising for a new roommate finds that something very strange is going on with the tenant who decides to move in." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105414/","name":"Single White Female","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNmMTNjYzEtNGIzOC00ZDc2LWFjN2UtZTNmZjgxZDJkNzBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ2MjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman advertising for a new roommate finds that something very strange is going on with the tenant who decides to move in.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hitchcockthelegend"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Who needs references these days anyway?","reviewBody":"Single White Female is directed by Barbet Schroeder and adapted to screenplay by Don Roos from the novel "SWF Seeks Same" written by John Lutz. It stars Bridget Fonda, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Steven Weber, Peter Friedman and Stephen Tobolowsky. Music is by Howard Shore and cinematography by Luciano Tovoli.

When it's revealed that her partner Sam (Weber) has been cheating on her with his ex-wife, Allie Jones (Fonda) kicks him out of the apartment and advertises for a female roommate. She chooses Hedra Carlson (Leigh), who on the surface seems to be the perfect roommate. Smoothly helping Allie through her crisis, a real friendship is formed, but it's not long before Hedra starts to exhibit some dark behaviour patterns ..

The early 90s saw the "Woman from Hell" back in vogue in mainstream cinema. After the success and publicity of Fatal Attraction (1987), there was a period where you feel that sensible film makers wisely chose to let that particular film disappear from the film lovers memory banks. As it happens, they must have collectively chose 5 years as the cooling off period. For 1992 saw a wave of mad female on the loose pictures released. Led by the publicity gobbling Basic Instinct, films such as The Hand That Rocks the Cradle and Single White Female put bums on cinema seats and reopened the "Mad Bitch" sub-genre. Of the three, Single White Female grossed the least, which is strange since it's a better movie than the other two.

Schroeder's (Barfly/Reversal of Fortune) movie isn't a complete success, there's not enough development of the main characters and there's some unintentionally funny moments. But when it's good it's real good. Reeling off a number of memorable and often chilling scenes, film is further boosted by the psychological smarts in Roos' (Boys on the Side) screenplay. It helps that Schroeder has a knack for pacing, too, where he neatly simmers the plot until the spill over for the big finale. No disappointment there either, a good combination of genre staples is enhanced in impact by some unexpected character developments, and there's moments of genuine suspense to lure the viewer to the edge of their seat. 

It's also stylishly shot by Schroeder and Tovoli (Suspiria/Tenebrae). Allie's Upper West Side apartment is imposing and expansive, with high ceilings, old time plumbing, a clunky lift and a dingy laundry in the basement. It's a different set-up for such a thriller, no picket fence harmony house or beach side residence, this is bustling New York, big spaces, but as it turns out, that means no hiding place. The boys behind the cameras get the maximum they can from the locale by blending imposing and ominous with grainy veneer and filtered light. On the acting front, the girls put great effort into making their thinly developed characters work, with Leigh doing a good line in progressive instability. While Friedman, Weber and a wonderfully naughty Tobolowsky, make the most of their secondary roles. 

One or two obvious flaws aside, this still rounds out as a thoroughly enjoyable thriller. 7.5/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35396,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1992-08-14","keywords":"female star appears nude,roommate,female nudity,bound and gagged,woman in bathtub","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2455550745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0M2E4NTgtOWQ3ZC00ZGI2LWFlY2ItNjdhNTVjODBkZDE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0M2E4NTgtOWQ3ZC00ZGI2LWFlY2ItNjdhNTVjODBkZDE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000403/","name":"Bridget Fonda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000492/","name":"Jennifer Jason Leigh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001836/","name":"Steven Weber"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0775447/","name":"Barbet Schroeder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1661375/","name":"John Lutz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740400/","name":"Don Roos"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Don't Let Them In
Don't Let Them In
programme.desc: Don't Let Them In: Directed by Mike Dunkin. With Scott Britton, Louis Dunkin, Amanda Hunt, Michelle Luther.
