programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 2
Naznaczony: rozdział 2
Insidious: Chapter 2
programme.desc: Insidious: Chapter 2: Directed by James Wan. With Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne, Barbara Hershey, Lin Shaye. The Lamberts believe that they have defeated the spirits that have haunted their family, but they soon discover that evil is not beaten so easily." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2226417/","name":"Insidious: Chapter 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0OTA5ODIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTUzNDg4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Lamberts believe that they have defeated the spirits that have haunted their family, but they soon discover that evil is not beaten so easily.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2226417/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jaguiar313"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Insidious sequel is spooky fun.","reviewBody":"Insidious: Chapter 2 starts up almost right after the original Insidious ended with Josh (Patrick Wilson) and Renai (Rose Byrne) Lambert reunited with their son Dalton (Ty Simpkins) after his spirit was held prisoner by a demon in an afterlife dimension called 'The Further'. But, as we saw in the final frames, something else was now inhabiting Josh's body and it had strangled paranormal investigator Elise (Lin Shaye) to death. We pick up as the unsuspecting family, including older son Foster (Andrew Astor) and their infant daughter Kali, have moved in with Josh's mother Lorraine (Barbara Hershey) while police investigate Elise's mysterious death in their house. They are barely moved in when supernatural occurrences start to begin again with objects moving, spectral voices, apparitions appearing and dear old dad acting very strange. While Renai tries to deal with the fact that supernatural forces are still with them, Josh tries to convince her all is well and Lorraine decides to team up with Elise's former assistants paranormal investigators Specs (Leigh Whannell who also wrote the screenplay) and Tucker (Angus Sampson) along with one of the original investigators from Josh's childhood haunting, Carl (Steve Coulter) to get down to the bottom of these haunted hi-jinx once and for all. And that is all I will say about the story as, despite some familiar trappings, James Wan (The Conjuring) takes this installment in some clever directions and once again uses the familiar elements very well. We get to know the story behind the evil woman in black seen in the last film and even revisit The Further though, this time it is inventively linked to events in the first film. The pace is a bit slower and more methodical this time round but, since this film is a bit of a mystery as well as haunting, it takes it's time to let the story unfold and secrets be revealed. We still get some spooky scenes but, it is refreshingly mixed in with Lorraine and co's equally goose bump inducing investigation. And what they find is deviously fun. The film is not quite as lively as Insidious part one but, I liked the mystery element and the film earned points with me for using it's return to 'The Further' a bit more clever and less silly then last time. That is the point where the first film lost it's grip on me and here I like how it was done and was with this supernatural chiller up to the spooky end. Wan is a good director and he takes what could have been a ho-hum retread and makes it a fun follow-up. He gets good performances out of all his cast and while I found Patrick Wilson to be bland in both Insidious and The Conjuring, he gets a far more lively performance out of him here. He gets to ham it up a bit and it suits him. The film has some beautiful and creepy visuals, as is Wan's trademark, and Joseph Bishara's score adds some nice atmosphere too. So in conclusion, while the story elements are more familiar; we've seen some of it before and the pace a bit slower, Wan does give us a spooky mystery to add to the paranormal activity and makes much more clever use of his otherworldly 'Further'. He also gives us some clever answers to the questions left by his first Insidious and that all adds up to a spooky fun time at the movies. Also stars House Of The Devil's Joceline Donahue as young Lorraine in some equally clever flashback sequences that tie into the rest of the film in a fun way."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":164356,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-09-13","keywords":"police detective,barricading a door,injection in leg,taser,attacked with a knife","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4286163225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA2ODQzODA0OTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU4NjU4MTAx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA2ODQzODA0OTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU4NjU4MTAx._V1_.jpg","description":"A haunted family struggles to uncover a terrifying secret that has left them dangerously connected to the spirit world in Insidious: Chapter 2."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933940/","name":"Patrick Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0126284/","name":"Rose Byrne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001347/","name":"Barbara Hershey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1490123/","name":"James Wan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314851/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1191481/","name":"Leigh Whannell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1490123/","name":"James Wan"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Inside Out
Naznaczony: rozdział 3
Insidious: Chapter 3
programme.desc:
Inside Out: Directed by Pete Docter, Ronnie Del Carmen. With Amy Poehler, Phyllis Smith, Richard Kind, Bill Hader. After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2096673/","name":"Inside Out","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTgxMDQwMDk0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjU5OTg2NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2096673/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Heinzwill"},"dateCreated":"2016-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beyond Words...","reviewBody":"It's been nearly a year since I first saw this film. I would say I had pretty low knowledge in films before I first saw Inside Out (not to say that I'm highly intelligent on films now). I only saw about 200 films prior. I hadn't seen a lot of classic films or even know that film can be an art form just through its camera work among other aspects. So you could say that I can't speak for everyone on my views of this film. And you may be right because opinions are subjective anyway.

This is my favourite film ever.

Like I said above, I didn't see a lot of films that were deemed as masterpieces at that time. While I still have a lot more to see, I can say that I have caught up with many notable ones now. I've seen The Godfather. I've seen 2001: A Space Odyssey. I've seen Casablanca. I've seen The Shawshank Redemption. I've seen Pulp Fiction. I've seen Lawrence of Arabia.

Yet this is still my favourite film of all-time.

80 years from now, this won't change. I felt something extraordinary that will never be felt again. This to me, was a revelation. In honest words I've never experienced something like this before. Only because of Inside Out I was able to kick myself off of a serious depression I had for years, understand the meaning of feeling, feel sympathy to why people act the way they do, be interested in films. In fact, I went and watched the films I mentioned above because of Inside Out.

Ever since that late July of 2015 I had been compulsively obsessed with Inside Out to the point where I checked its Oscar chances, IMDb rating, Rotten Tomatoes rating and box office grosses to the point where I felt like I had to stop myself from doing as when seeing anything negative about it just makes feel let down and quite sad about it. It's still something that I'm trying to quit but obviously it's not going that well (ie. this review after one year of the film's release).

Inside Out taught me more about depression, empathy, importance of sorrow and interpersonal relationships than any books, talk shows, real-life stories or cat posters could ever dream of. It made me want to become a filmmaker because if this much craft and intelligence can be put in a film, then sign me up to the industry because I want to be a part of it. I don't want to talk about the story or the technical aspects of Inside Out because everyone has talked about it already.

In the course of less than ten months, I've see this film six times. That's more than any other film during the same period. It's a true testament to its strength and impact on me that's hardly ever going to fade away. I know this isn't the case for everybody. I keep trying to find anybody else who had the same experience as I did walking out of this film for the first time. I yielded only little results and although it brings me down a little since I don't really have anyone else to relate to, I keep telling myself, that no matter what happens to Inside Out in the future, whether its Rotten Tomatoes score or IMDb rating or its overall stature among the general public, whether it gets worse or better for it, this will always be favourite film of all-time. Nothing will change that and I have to let go of everybody else's opinion whether or not they had similar emotional experiences towards it.

You can vote "not helpful" on this review all you want (which seems to be a recurring case for all positive user reviews here.... I wonder why...) but it's not going to matter anyway. This is a beautiful film that will resonate in me always.

I will never forget Inside Out.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":660021,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-06-17","keywords":"joy,sadness,anger,memory,running away","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters: June 19","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi203730969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyNDg5MjEwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQyNDM5NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyNDg5MjEwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQyNDM5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Inside Out is in theaters on June 19!"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688132/","name":"Amy Poehler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0352778/","name":"Bill Hader"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085400/","name":"Lewis Black"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230032/","name":"Pete Docter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0215455/","name":"Ronnie Del Carmen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017902/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230032/","name":"Pete Docter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0215455/","name":"Ronnie Del Carmen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0498834/","name":"Meg LeFauve"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: O co biega?
programme.desc: W magazynie nowinki oraz praktyczne porady dla osób, które uprawiają bieganie rekreacyjnie, półprofesjonalnie, zawodowo lub dopiero zaczynają. Gospodarz programu Marcin Rosłoń wraz z ekspertami będzie podpowiadał, jak przygotować się do biegania amatorskiego i zawodowego, jak dobrać odpowiedni sprzęt lub przygotować się do maratonu. W programie nie zabraknie również ciekawostek, rozmów ze sportowcami i osobami z show-biznesu, które opowiedzą o swojej pasji do biegania.

programme.title: Fit for a Prince
Fit for a Prince
programme.desc:
Fit for a Prince: Directed by Marita Grabiak. With Jonathan Keltz, Natalie Hall, Melinda Michael, Tanya Clarke. A fashion designer is hired to dress ladies of a wealthy family which are hosting an upcoming charity ball. Cindy's life takes an unexpected turn when Prince Ronan becomes smitten with her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt14039028/","name":"Fit for a Prince","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGRmYjFiOTQtOWY3MS00OTdlLTk4ZmItMzY0MjdhMTczZjQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjAwNzczNTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fashion designer is hired to dress ladies of a wealthy family which are hosting an upcoming charity ball. Cindy's life takes an unexpected turn when Prince Ronan becomes smitten with her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt14039028/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cgvsluis"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"If I can restore things with my hands I am sure I can be of some help.","reviewBody":"Natalie Hall who plays Cindy is delightful! But what I truly enjoyed about this film is how the prince sees through the facade and figures out very quickly who the real designer is behind Rebecca Roslyn's designs. Not only does he obtain this information quickly, but he is not easily fooled in to thinking otherwise...and he is incredible supportive of someone who he views as an incredibly talented, hard working, under appreciated designer.

When his group of friends intentionally trick Cindy in to underdressing for an event, the prince goes out of his way to try to make her feel comfortable by also dressing down. This isn't the only way he tries to build her up and make her feel comfortable...at one point in spite not being able to sew, he helps Cindy remake dresses for the ball under an extreme time crunch. He is really beyond too impossible to be true! But that is why we watch Hallmark, isn't it? Therefore Prince Ronan is perfect, as ordered!

I appreciated how the romantic rival, after initially doing something mean spirited, turns a new leaf and champions her rival before the last five minutes of the film where they usually cede there defeat. I also really appreciated the actress who was the grandmother (I think) who was real and honest...and telling like it was from the onset.

"Spontaneous, in the moment, out of character."

As mentioned, Natalie Hall is delightful and you should watch this film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":688,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-03-06","keywords":"pennsylvania,fashion designer,seamstress,prince,eligible bachelor","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1947831/","name":"Jonathan Keltz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2834250/","name":"Natalie Hall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5711531/","name":"Melinda Michael"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0333239/","name":"Marita Grabiak"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197380/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12070716/","name":"T. programme.title: The East
Ida
programme.desc:
The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AvidClimber"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stunning and unpretentious","reviewBody":"The East is the kind of movie that makes you want to join the fight, raise your voice and be heard.

The good. Extremely immersive. A incredible story with lots of emotions, conflicts, opposing moralities, and a stupefying journey. It is gripping and you will not be left unmoved.

The actors. Brit Marling and Ellen Page both give us a great performance. I was disappointed by Alexander Skarsgård, I thought that he was the weak player of the cast. The rest of the cell was pretty solid: Toby Kebbell, Shiloh Fernandez, Aldis Hodge, and Danielle Macdonald. And I should mention the nice work done by Patricia Clarkson as the director of the private security firm.

The bad. The ending is rushed. It feels like there was missing material at the end of filming and they couldn't go back to get what they needed and had to edit it with what they had.

The ugly. Nothing.

The result. A must see for anyone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,nude swimming,male nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002907/","name":"Alexander Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680983/","name":"Elliot Page"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Trzy i pół godziny
programme.desc: Monachium, 13 sierpnia 1961 roku. Pasażerowie pociągu do Berlina Wschodniego dowiadują się o budowie muru dzielącego miasto. Do granicy dotrą za trzy i pół godziny. W tym czasie muszą podjąć decyzję, czy wysiąść, czy jechać dalej. Przed trudnym wyborem staje m.in. Marlis podróżująca z mężem Gerdem i dzieckiem.

programme.title: One Fine Day
Szczęśliwy dzień
One Fine Day
programme.desc:
One Fine Day: Directed by Michael Hoffman. With Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman, Alex D. Linz. The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117247/","name":"One Fine Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdhMjgxODQtZjNhNS00YjZiLWFmYTAtODZmM2RhM2M3YmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117247/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philipdavies"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment ...","reviewBody":"The headlong screwball comedy of this breakneck romance of two stressed-out single parents is a delight from beginning to end. It has scenes as quick witted - and often as wackily off-kilter! - as the adults must be just in order to survive their average day. Stir love into this mess of two increasingly desparate modern lives and you get a miraculous souffle of a film, at once sharp and sweet.

No scene is laboured, no point is telegraphed, and - phenomenally for a modern American film - neither kids nor kittens are allowed to smother the audience in the nauseous layers of cutesiness that are usually applied. The scene with the analyst, where Clooney must obscure his account of his sex-life in an ever-more-surrealistic periphrasis involving iced cakes and fish, since his little daughter has to accompany him into the presumably crecheless analyst's surgery, and her dad is embarassed to expose her to such adult matters as he is obliged to reveal during the session, is a scene which is a model of intelligent and stylish comedy writing. The dialogue of both himself and his analyst finally founders on the increasingly strained comparisons and metaphors being attempted. The analyst begins to construct an alarmingly kinky lifestyle for his client out of what he takes to be Freudian suggestions - but which are, as noted, merely the product of old-fashioned seemliness - whereupon Clooney is forced to bring the whole towering edifice back down to earth when his version of the morning's business with the goldfish gets mixed up in the heady brew of symbolism: 'No. I mean fish. You know - 'Fish' fish?'

The humour is all good, never strained, and beautifully played by all the principals, including the wonderfully un-sentimentalised children. The transformation, stage-by-stage, of the harsh mutual competition and resentment that exists at first between these harassed adults, into an exhausted truce, by way of barely-restrained irritation, grudging gratitude, reluctant respect, and growing affection, is handled with considerable dramatic finesse throughout.

To produce the unlikely union of such an ill-assorted pair under such utterly unpropitious and unromantic circumstances is a comedic challenge of considerable proportions, and the makers of this film do an excellent job to bring it off at all. The spirits of Grant and Hepburn - even Beatrice and Benedict - are not too far away.

The only disappointment is to see how many people in the audience have gone home just as sour as when they arrived, judging from some of the comments here. But then, love curdles in any mean-spirited breast.

 One particularly admires the fact that, at its conclusion, the film's romantic clincher - when the tired-out couple have to settle for just falling asleep together, despite their by now clearly desparate need for each other, - insists upon the importance of exactly this: Love, rather than merely lust, as the basis for an adult relationship.

Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment. It makes a pleasant and wholesome change from the usual fare of adolescent dreams."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45255,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1996-12-20","keywords":"architect,united states,usa,mother son relationship,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"One Fine Day","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3298689305","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926165/","name":"Mae Whitman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001355/","name":"Michael Hoffman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002149/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0195234/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0783559/","name":"Terrel Seltzer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800124/","name":"Ellen Simon"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0117247, Title: One Fine Day, --- Description: One Fine Day: Directed by Michael Hoffman. With Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman, Alex D. Linz. The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117247/","name":"One Fine Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdhMjgxODQtZjNhNS00YjZiLWFmYTAtODZmM2RhM2M3YmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117247/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"philipdavies","dateCreated":"2003-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment ...","reviewBody":"The headlong screwball comedy of this breakneck romance of two stressed-out single parents is a delight from beginning to end. It has scenes as quick witted - and often as wackily off-kilter! - as the adults must be just in order to survive their average day. Stir love into this mess of two increasingly desparate modern lives and you get a miraculous souffle of a film, at once sharp and sweet.

No scene is laboured, no point is telegraphed, and - phenomenally for a modern American film - neither kids nor kittens are allowed to smother the audience in the nauseous layers of cutesiness that are usually applied. The scene with the analyst, where Clooney must obscure his account of his sex-life in an ever-more-surrealistic periphrasis involving iced cakes and fish, since his little daughter has to accompany him into the presumably crecheless analyst's surgery, and her dad is embarassed to expose her to such adult matters as he is obliged to reveal during the session, is a scene which is a model of intelligent and stylish comedy writing. The dialogue of both himself and his analyst finally founders on the increasingly strained comparisons and metaphors being attempted. The analyst begins to construct an alarmingly kinky lifestyle for his client out of what he takes to be Freudian suggestions - but which are, as noted, merely the product of old-fashioned seemliness - whereupon Clooney is forced to bring the whole towering edifice back down to earth when his version of the morning's business with the goldfish gets mixed up in the heady brew of symbolism: 'No. I mean fish. You know - 'Fish' fish?'

The humour is all good, never strained, and beautifully played by all the principals, including the wonderfully un-sentimentalised children. The transformation, stage-by-stage, of the harsh mutual competition and resentment that exists at first between these harassed adults, into an exhausted truce, by way of barely-restrained irritation, grudging gratitude, reluctant respect, and growing affection, is handled with considerable dramatic finesse throughout.

To produce the unlikely union of such an ill-assorted pair under such utterly unpropitious and unromantic circumstances is a comedic challenge of considerable proportions, and the makers of this film do an excellent job to bring it off at all. The spirits of Grant and Hepburn - even Beatrice and Benedict - are not too far away.

The only disappointment is to see how many people in the audience have gone home just as sour as when they arrived, judging from some of the comments here. But then, love curdles in any mean-spirited breast.

 One particularly admires the fact that, at its conclusion, the film's romantic clincher - when the tired-out couple have to settle for just falling asleep together, despite their by now clearly desparate need for each other, - insists upon the importance of exactly this: Love, rather than merely lust, as the basis for an adult relationship.

Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment. It makes a pleasant and wholesome change from the usual fare of adolescent dreams.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45255,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1996-12-20","keywords":"architect,united states,usa,mother son relationship,friendship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"One Fine Day","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3298689305","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926165/","name":"Mae Whitman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001355/","name":"Michael Hoffman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002149/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0195234/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0783559/","name":"Terrel Seltzer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800124/","name":"Ellen Simon"],"duration":"PT1H48M"</script><metacontent="

THE STAND-IN is the story of a disaffected comedy actress and her ambitious stand-in trading places." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7970348/","name":"The Stand In","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjE0YWZjZTItMmUwYy00OGNlLWJkZmItZDk2YWJjZmViOTBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY1MTg4Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"THE STAND-IN is the story of a disaffected comedy actress and her ambitious stand-in trading places.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7970348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mauricioalexisveliz"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not a comedy but it's a good movie!","reviewBody":"Ok, I understand the bad reviews because the movie was presented as a comedy, but it's not a comedy at all. It's more of a drama / thriller movie and within those genres it works very well. Drew Barrymore did an excellent job, she played two roles, this depressed, overwhelmed woman with severe problems and on the other hand there is this other character, who at first seems to be a happy girl with problems but innocent, although little by little she is showing her true essence. So if you are going to see this movie, I recommend you not to see it as a comedy, because you will not find jokes, funny scenes, etc. See this movie for what it is, a drama with touches of thriller. And I repeat, Drew Barrymore really did an excellent job here!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2980,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-12-11","keywords":"actress","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3136274713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhmMGVhMzktMjQwNC00YWIyLWI0ZWEtMzU0ODQzNjcwOWU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhmMGVhMzktMjQwNC00YWIyLWI0ZWEtMzU0ODQzNjcwOWU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When ordered to serve a year in rehab, actress Candy (Drew Barrymore) hires her on set stand-in to take her place. programme.title: Jestem REN
Jestem REN
programme.desc: Jestem REN: Directed by Patricia Ryczko. With Marta Król, Marcin Sztabinski, Marieta Zukowska, Janusz Chabior. We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that her android self is her own fantasy. She begins to cooperate with the therapy, realizing she will be able to return to her family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11067160/","name":"Jestem REN","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFiNDYxZDQtYzZjOC00NmU5LTllYjEtZjc4MWFhZGRhZTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzUwOTc4NjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that h","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11067160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fxflinn"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thought provoking parable of mental illness","reviewBody":"Caught this at the Boston Science Fiction Film Festival in Feb 2020. It's a tidy, well made film that draws you into a family battling the mental illness of the mother, who believes she is a sentient android who has malfunctioned. But maybe she is a human who has constructed an elaborate backstory to hide from the pain of being a person who cannot love and who cannot stop beating her on-the-cusp of manhood son. The material clues suggest we are in our time, not some future echoing the television series "Humans," but we are looking at the world through the eyes of the narrator, the mother, and she sees clues about her android origin everywhere. By the time the movie reaches its conclusion, you've been drawn into the madness, the uncertainty of what is human, what is programming, and profound discomfort for the mom and her interior life. The dedication at the end of the film makes it clear the filmmaker wanted to share his experience with his mother and her struggle. He succeeded. The intimate cinematography is a case study in how closeups and lighting can draw an audience into the interior life of the characters. The actors all do a fine job, particularly Marta Krol in the role of the mother and Marieta Zukowska as her peer, counterpart, alter ego or therapist -- when you are in psychosis, those around you play many roles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":74,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-03-27","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2067989/","name":"Marta Król"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2029225/","name":"Marcin Sztabinski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2346424/","name":"Marieta Zukowska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0734708/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0767135/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0778711/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Marek Edelman... i była miłość w getcie
programme.desc: Zmarły w 2009 roku Marek Edelman był ostatnim przywódcą powstania w getcie warszawskim. Przed swoją śmiercią odpowiedział na pytanie, czy w getcie była miłość i jak ona się przejawiała. Film jest odpowiedzią na książkę Marka Edelmana i Pauli Sawickiej o tym samym tytule, która zawiera wspomnienia mężczyzny. Przy jego scenariuszu współpracowała Agnieszka Holland, a jego fabularyzowane sceny współreżyserował Andrzej Wajda.

credits.actor: Monika Kwiatkowska, Bogusław Suszka, Paweł Deląg

programme.title: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto
Polański, Horowitz. Hometown
programme.desc: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto: Directed by Mateusz Kudla, Anna Kokoszka-Romer. With Roman Polanski, Ryszard Horowitz, Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska, Stanislaw Buchala. Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8546414/","name":"Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg0NmQ3NmEtY2NkOC00ZmI2LTg3YmUtNTc2MGEwNWQ2OWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk5MjEzMTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8546414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"belenus-133-722656"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very moving true strory.","reviewBody":"This is a beautiful documentary. It takes you right into the heart of the darkest period in the 20th century, right into the heart of a Holocaust - Krakow in Poland, where the famous Plaszow ghetto was located and where the trains were loaded for Auschwitz. It's also a very intimate and moving portrait of a true friendship between two great artists. We get to see incredible suffering but also have a chance to witness a fantastic sense of humour, which obviously is the best way to deal with such sad memories. We can also now understand why Polanski refused to film "The Shindler's List" and instead filmed "The Pianist". We should be very grateful to film authors. PS - People who give this film a low rating obviously have not seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2021-08-20","keywords":"childhood","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1058543/","name":"Ryszard Horowitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7061785/","name":"Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0701909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Pianist
Pianista
The Pianist
programme.desc:
The Pianist: Directed by Roman Polanski. With Adrien Brody, Emilia Fox, Michal Zebrowski, Ed Stoppard. A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253474/","name":"The Pianist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRiZDIxZjktMTA1NC00MDQ2LWEzMjUtMTliZmY3NjQ3ODJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ashcoounter"},"dateCreated":"2003-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliantly Narrated, Visually Stunning!","reviewBody":"Polanski has depicted the gory details of the holocaust without much restraint. But, the most wonderful aspect of the film is that the director has not lost focus of his story and instead of focusing too much on the holocaust horror he has weaved the true-life narrative of survival around devillish happenings.

Every single act of escapade Szpilman goes through is depicted like a drop of water on a barren desert. However, the Oasis in the driest desert comes in the end and it is here that Polanski captures the essence of human emotion. I had this very strong urge of jumping into the theater screen and magically adopting a character in the movie and doing something about the helplesness portrayed so convincingly.

Overall, Polanski has given a stunning visual narrative of the cold war. Survival indeed is a privilege though it is taken for granted today. Performances by Brody, Kretschmann deserve applause.

Pawel Edelman's camera work is moving and he has brilliantly captured the dark sadness in the visual canvas in an effective way. The lighting is amazing. Pre-dawn shooting schedule could have helped a great deal.

Hervé de Luze's editing work has ensured that the narrative does not slip away from focus. Most notable is the scene where the human bodies are lit on fire and the camera raises to show the smoke. The darkness of the smoke is enhanced and is used effectively to fade the scene out.

The scene where Brody's fingers move as he rests his hands on the bars of the tram handle only goes to show the brilliance of Polanski as a film-maker.

Great film that will be in the running for this year's Oscars. I will give it a 9 Out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":777302,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Biography","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"pianist,holocaust,survival,nazi occupied poland,person in a wheelchair falls from height","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Pianist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi988938521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004778/","name":"Adrien Brody"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470981/","name":"Thomas Kretschmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277975/","name":"Frank Finlay"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024473/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030304/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367838/","name":"Ronald Harwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0844262/","name":"Wladyslaw Szpilman"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Life in a Year
Rok na całe życie
Life In A Year
programme.desc:
Life in a Year: Directed by Mitja Okorn. With Jaden Smith, Cara Delevingne, Cuba Gooding Jr., Chris D'Elia. The movie follows 17-year-old Daryn who finds out that his girlfriend is dying. He sets out to give her an entire life in the last year she has left." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6598238/","name":"Life in a Year","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTNiY2Y4MjMtM2MyMi00ODYxLTk4N2MtNjhkYjVkODFjNmRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDg0MDgxNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The movie follows 17-year-old Daryn who finds out that his girlfriend is dying. He sets out to give her an entire life in the last year she has left.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6598238/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Retread teen issues, see it if it is free.","reviewBody":"Beware, there are several "10" reviews by people who just recently have established their accounts, most likely studio shills to get the rating up. This is becoming more and more routine on the IMDb. You'd best ignore them.

My greatest disappointment with this film is casting Jaden Smith as the boyfriend. If you do a search on the terms "can't act" you might well get a photo of Jaden Smith. He drags the movie down.

A few years ago he was featured in "After Earth" with his dad, on that role I wrote, "This is a very plain story, and relies on young Jaden Smith to convince us he can carry an action movie. He showed us he can't. He is not a good actor, and he enunciates so poorly that we often had difficulty even understanding what he said."

Other than that it is a decent story, although told many times before, and Cara Delevingne is really good in a challenging role. See the movie if you will, just don't expect too much. It is available FREE on Amazon so you are only out a bit of your time."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7393,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-12-16","keywords":"girlfriend,blue green hair,pink hair","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi456704281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc3YmViMGYtYjgyNi00NDg2LTk2MTEtNDVmOTI4ODQ2MzRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc3YmViMGYtYjgyNi00NDg2LTk2MTEtNDVmOTI4ODQ2MzRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"The movie follows 17-year-old Daryn who finds out that his girlfriend is dying. He sets out to give her an entire life in the last year she has left."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1535523/","name":"Jaden Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5353321/","name":"Cara Delevingne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000421/","name":"Cuba Gooding Jr."}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1840911/","name":"Mitja Okorn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072775/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2731620/","name":"Jeffrey Addiss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2176993/","name":"Will Matthews"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

Wiera is a beautiful and well-trained agent of the former KGB, sent to Poland to steal the young genius's potion. programme.title: Baggage Claim
Bez bagażu
Baggage Claim
programme.desc: Baggage Claim: Directed by David E. Talbert. With Paula Patton, Derek Luke, Taye Diggs, Boris Kodjoe. Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancé." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1171222/","name":"Baggage Claim","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyNDU4NTY3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTA3MDA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancé.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1171222/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"demetriocoffman"},"dateCreated":"2013-10-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"To predictable, to corny and just too bad.","reviewBody":"I love a good romantic comedy but Baggage Claim in nowhere even near that type of movie. It seemed more like an corny SNL skit that lasts over an hour. I had the movie already figured out in the first 15 minutes and had to endure the rest of the flick. This plot is just one notch above that goofy Soul Plane from a few years back and a few below Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail. A better script, more realistic characters and a more serious touch the movie might be average. Paula Patton is beautiful as always that you can't deny and Ty Diggs is an accomplished actor but they need to move on into some more serious roles. My advise is don't waste your time on this one. I still can't believe I didn't walk out.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9138,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2013-09-27","keywords":"gay character,woman wears only a man's shirt,marriage proposal,karaoke bar,karaoke","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1964549657","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTEzOTg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY4MzA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTEzOTg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY4MzA1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pledging to keep herself from being the oldest and the only woman in her entire family never to wed, Montana embarks on a thirty-day, thirty-thousand-mile expedition to charm a potential suitor into becoming her fiancÃ©."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1745736/","name":"Paula Patton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004875/","name":"Taye Diggs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779325/","name":"Jill Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0847859/","name":"David E. programme.title: The Song of Names
Pieśń imion
The Song of Names
programme.desc: The Song of Names: Directed by François Girard. With Eddie Izzard, Gerran Howell, Stanley Townsend, Amy Sloan. Several years after his childhood friend, a violin prodigy, disappears on the eve of his first solo concert, an Englishman travels throughout Europe to find him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1657517/","name":"The Song of Names","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGY5N2U3YzktNDU5NC00Mzc5LWI4YmEtZTI0MWRiYjdlZjg3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTgxNDIzMTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Several years after his childhood friend, a violin prodigy, disappears on the eve of his first solo concert, an Englishman travels throughout Europe to find him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1657517/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"esso-54799"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"A poignant movie","reviewBody":"What a great movie, believable and well scripted. programme.title: Be Water
Jak woda
Be Water
programme.desc: Be Water: Directed by Bao Nguyen. With Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Linda Lee Cadwell, Dan Inosanto, Diana Lee Inosanto. Rejected by Hollywood, Bruce Lee returned to Hong Kong to complete four films. Charting his struggles in two worlds, Be Water explores questions of identity and representation through rare archive, intimate interviews, and his writings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11394168/","name":"Be Water","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNhNzY3N2UtZjIwYi00NDEyLTlmMzMtZGI3ZGUwZTM1MWY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Rejected by Hollywood, Bruce Lee returned to Hong Kong to complete four films. Charting his struggles in two worlds, Be Water explores questions of identity and representation through rare archive, intimate interviews, and his writin","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11394168/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eliotar6998"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Hero Worth Idolizing","reviewBody":"The inspirational value of Bruce Lee is best expressed by his response to the question of whether he thought of himself as Chinese or American. "You know what I want to think of myself," he said, "as a human being." Bruce Lee was a man who spent his entire life building bridges; between styles of martial arts, between cultures at odds with one another, and between inner and external philosophies. He felt that true strength comes from within, and that by recognizing that strength, as well as all the flaws that coexist alongside it, one can achieve greatness despite all odds. Bruce Lee is a hero worth idolizing because he did not see himself as one. He did not view himself as a star, or a saint. He was true to himself, accepting the good with the bad. He was confident, but not conceited, wise, but not condescending. He was a man who fought for all he achieved, and deserved every ounce of his success.\n\nIt is essential, given the current climate of racial injustice in the United States, that a documentary about a man who played such a role in dismantling prejudice against Asian-Americans take all the racial factors involved into full consideration and treat them respectfully and knowledgeably, and this documentary does exactly that. It is about Bruce Lee, yes, but more importantly it is about the struggle that he and so many Asian-Americans face even today. It is a story of a man who was able to raise himself above it all, against all odds, and prove to the world that an Asian man could outshine any leading actor, and that by virtue of his determination was equally if not more deserving of the superstardom so often relegated to the white Hollywood elite.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1386,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2020-06-07","keywords":"bruce lee","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2435890713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGEzN2Q0YWEtNjIyNi00YTMxLTlmN2UtYTFkY2M0YTc4YmE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGEzN2Q0YWEtNjIyNi00YTMxLTlmN2UtYTFkY2M0YTc4YmE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Take a first look at 'Be Water,' a 30 for 30 film that intimately chronicles Bruce Lee's life and complex journey, which premieres on Sunday, June 7th at 9pm ET on ESPN"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000717/","name":"Kareem Abdul-Jabbar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004791/","name":"Linda Lee Cadwell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0409261/","name":"Dan Inosanto"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3686143/","name":"Bao Nguyen"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The New Mutants
Nowi mutanci
The New Mutants
programme.desc: The New Mutants: Directed by Josh Boone. With Maisie Williams, Anya Taylor-Joy, Charlie Heaton, Alice Braga. Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4682266/","name":"The New Mutants","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ2NTdmNDgtMGIwMS00ODE2LTk5M2EtZGZhYzc4MWRlNTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc4MjczMTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4682266/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sara-691"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"This movie desperately needed whatever they edited out.","reviewBody":"It was an OK movie all in all, but it could've been SO much better. I was personally stoked for a horror mutants movie, but this is as much horror as any other superhero movie (and less than some) so I must say I was very disappointed. The idea of was there and it could've been SO SO good but in the end, it wasn't...\n\nA thing that really distracted me was the actors weird accents. You have a group of really good actors here but the bad accents made them just seem mediocre.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68455,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2020-08-28","keywords":"mutant,based on comic book,marvel comics,x men,superheroine","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Comic-Con Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1041219097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIyNDQxZDgtNTY0NS00ZDcxLTkwNDgtYjQ1ZGI0NGU2ODcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIyNDQxZDgtNTY0NS00ZDcxLTkwNDgtYjQ1ZGI0NGU2ODcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Twentieth Century Studios in association with Marvel Entertainment presents The New Mutants, an original horror thriller set in an isolated hospital where a group of young mutants is being held for psychiatric monitoring. When strange occurrences begin to take place, both their new mutant abilities and their friendships will be tested as they battle to try and make it out alive. Directed by Josh Boone (The Fault in our Stars) and written by Josh Boone & Knate Lee, The New Mutants stars: Maisie Williams (Game of Thrones); Anya Taylor-Joy (Glass); Charlie Heaton (Stranger Things); Alice Braga (Predators); Blu Hunt (The Originals); and Henry Zaga (13 Reasons Why). The film is produced by Simon Kinberg, p.g.a., Karen Rosenfelt and Lauren Shuler Donner with Stan Lee and Michele Imperato Stabile serving as executive producers."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3586035/","name":"Maisie Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5896355/","name":"Anya Taylor-Joy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6390427/","name":"Charlie Heaton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1837748/","name":"Josh Boone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0781821/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0566686/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047120/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1837748/","name":"Josh Boone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1029878/","name":"Knate Lee"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Breaking News in Yuba County
Skandal w hrabstwie Yuba
Breaking News In Yuba County
programme.desc:
Breaking News in Yuba County: Directed by Tate Taylor. With Allison Janney, Mila Kunis, Regina Hall, Awkwafina. A woman takes advantage of her growing celebrity status when the police and the public think her dead husband is just missing." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7737640/","name":"Breaking News in Yuba County","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWJkMTg1NWUtN2E0Yy00Y2M4LWEyMjItMjQ4ZDBiYmY3ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman takes advantage of her growing celebrity status when the police and the public think her dead husband is just missing.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7737640/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"stklaus"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"I'm not sure why critics hate this one","reviewBody":"This is a light black slapstick comedy, which runs low-key, nothing spectacular, but is never boring. The humour and the film is driven by its entangled plot, for once it doesn't comprise laugh-out-loud, gross (there is some violence) or forced jokes, no, it's the satiric story that is fun and entertaining.

Since lots of people are involved, I give you some story infos for an easier watch (which won't spoil anything):

Her (A.Janney) husband Karl (M. Modine), a banker, was involved in money laundering and now ows money to the bad guys. Her brother Pete (J. Simpson) seemed to do some robbery and is also involved with the bad guys coincidentally. Her sister (Mila Kunis) works for a small TV station.

After lots and lots of bad comedies this was a surprise; maybe it's a bit harsh with American lifestyle, thats why they hated it(?)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4439,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-02-12","keywords":"place name in title,county name in title,place in title,search for missing husband,half sister","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3228614937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDk1NTI2MTctN2NkMy00MDdhLWI5MjYtYjY1ZDA4ZmExMDhmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDk1NTI2MTctN2NkMy00MDdhLWI5MjYtYjY1ZDA4ZmExMDhmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"After her husband goes missing, Sue Buttons (Allison Janney), an underappreciated suburban wife, gets a taste of being a local celebrity as she embarks on a search to find him. She quickly finds herself in over her head, dodging cops, criminals and local reporters all aiming to uncover the truth. After being overlooked for so long, Sue goes to exaggerated lengths to prolong her "15 minutes of fame" and keep the truth from coming out."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005049/","name":"Allison Janney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005109/","name":"Mila Kunis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0356021/","name":"Regina Hall"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0853238/","name":"Tate Taylor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0690042/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0564372/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0785702/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3302028/","name":"Amanda Idoko"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Roads Not Taken
Niewybrane drogi
The Roads Not Taken
programme.desc:
The Roads Not Taken: Directed by Sally Potter. With Javier Bardem, Elle Fanning, Branka Katic, Salma Hayek. A day in the life of Leo and his daughter, Molly, as he floats through alternate lives he could have lived, leading Molly to wrestle with her own path as she considers her future." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9411866/","name":"The Roads Not Taken","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2UyM2U3NTctNTRlOS00Yzg5LTgxZTItNmM0MWE4ODEwMjg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MjcyOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A day in the life of Leo and his daughter, Molly, as he floats through alternate lives he could have lived, leading Molly to wrestle with her own path as she considers her future.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9411866/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jcobane"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ring ring ring ring ring ring ring ring ring ring.","reviewBody":"The Roads Not Taken begins with a ringing phone over the opening credits. The credits are synced to the ringing. It took me years to get past the beginning of Once Upon a Time in America, beginning as it did with an incessantly ringing telephone. Every time I'd just throw my hands up and say not today, Sergio!

But eventually I got over that hump and was richly rewarded. Which is why I simply dug my fingernails into my palms and waited this one out. I'm glad I did. For whatever reason, there's always a good movie on the other side of an interminably ringing phone.

(It has a point, the ringing. It's thematic.)

The movie is hypnotically paced. Somewhere in the back of my mind I imagined myself glancing at my watch, stopping the film, and doing something else with my time. But I never glanced at my watch. Not once. OK, there was the one time I checked how much longer the film had to go, but not because I was bored -- it was because I was worried it would end too soon.

The performances are -- let me say this. It's not fantasy. I thought the premise (or at least my initial interpretation of the title) was going to go in more of a whimsical About Time-ish direction. Like this is a man who is experiencing a supernatural event in which he must choose which path to take. It's not that. It's very much a man with dementia existing in different places in his memories, envisioning different choices, while his daughter tries to connect with him in the present.

So the performances are brilliant. There was a moment in a cab early in the movie when I was afraid Sally Potter was going to do like what Terrence Malick did with those three little weird movies of his. You know the ones I mean. Where he just got his video camera and followed actors around. They were like, "So where's the script, Terry?" And he was like, "JUST DO WHATEVER YOU WANT, I'LL FIGURE IT OUT IN POST."

There's a bit in a Costco parking garage that's just perfect.

Lastly, I want to talk about the music. It's the best thing about the movie. I will be buying the soundtrack. I haven't bought a film soundtrack since The Mission.

Oh and one more thing, with regards to phones ringing in films -- there's a limit. It's two. Two rings! That's all you get! If you need more you gotta use silent film intertitles. Them's the rules.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1989,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-03-13","keywords":"dementia,father daughter relationship,life","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Roads Not Taken","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2069610265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjdkMzQwNjItZWU3MC00ODEyLWI4M2UtZjk4NWQ3MmM2MTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjdkMzQwNjItZWU3MC00ODEyLWI4M2UtZjk4NWQ3MmM2MTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000849/","name":"Javier Bardem"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1102577/","name":"Elle Fanning"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0441287/","name":"Branka Katic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006845/","name":"Sally Potter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103055/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037450/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006845/","name":"Sally Potter"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zloto dezerterów
Złoto dezerterów
programme.desc:
Zloto dezerterów: Directed by Janusz Majewski. With Marek Kondrat, Boguslaw Linda, Wiktor Zborowski, Katarzyna Figura. During World War II a group of safe-crackers sets off on a mission to steal gold from a Nazi bank." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0191666/","name":"Zloto dezerterów","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM4OTI4ZGUtNmQyZS00NjZiLWE4OWUtNDA3Y2RkOGE4ZTkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II a group of safe-crackers sets off on a mission to steal gold from a Nazi bank.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0191666/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Maziun"},"dateCreated":"2013-08-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bad sequel to fun movie","reviewBody":"This is a sequel to movie from 1985 – HK Deserters" . The heroes from the first movie also appear here , but there is plenty of new heroes . The first movie was a war comedy about a group of friends running away from army . This one is supposed to be a war comedy about stealing gold from Nazi's.

It was supposed to be comedy . Unfortunately the movie takes itself way too seriously . The movie unnecessary tries to tell something about anti-Semitism , betrayal and courage of freedom fighters. For more than half of the movie is hard to tell that this is comedy . When the so-called jokes appear in the second half of the movie they so awful you will groan. The movie also feels too long (it's 2 hours long ) , which wasn't a problem in the first movie (which was almost 3 hours long) . Gone is the charm and the fun of original.

The acting is good and the music is very jolly . Still , it's too little to save the movie from being a disaster. I give it 1/10. Better watch "Kelly's heroes". Or the original – "HK Deserters".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":493,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"genre":["Action","Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"1998-12-04","keywords":"1940s,world war two","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464945/","name":"Marek Kondrat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0511277/","name":"Boguslaw Linda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953975/","name":"Wiktor Zborowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538105/","name":"Janusz Majewski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538105/","name":"Janusz Majewski"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

Najdłuższa podróż
The Longest Ride
programme.desc: The Longest Ride: Directed by George Tillman Jr.. With Britt Robertson, Scott Eastwood, Alan Alda, Jack Huston. The lives of a young couple intertwine with a much older man, as he reflects back on a past love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2726560/","name":"The Longest Ride","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIzMjg0NjQwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODAwOTE4MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of a young couple intertwine with a much older man, as he reflects back on a past love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2726560/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"authortinaleonard"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such a cute film","reviewBody":"My husband and I really enjoyed this. It's sweet and romantic. If you like a movie without swearing and gratuitous sex, etc., this is a feel-good story. Alan Alda was wonderful, and we enjoyed seeing him in this role. Scott Eastwood was convincing as a PBR rider trying not to become a has-been and working through issues of his own. There's action for the guys (bull riding), and something for the ladies (bull riding, and a flash of Scott Eastwood's nice buttocks-thank you for that-so there's something for everyone. The actress who played Alan Alda's wife was absolutely darling. Very romantic film about two people who had a meet-cute and found their lives changed in many ways.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":80193,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance","Western"],"datePublished":"2015-04-15","keywords":"usa,united states,college student,college,bull riding","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2592911641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2NTkwODY1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzUwOTQ4NDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2NTkwODY1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzUwOTQ4NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of a young couple intertwine with a much older man as he reflects back on a lost love while he's trapped in an automobile crash."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207222/","name":"Scott Eastwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1429380/","name":"Britt Robertson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000257/","name":"Alan Alda"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0863387/","name":"George Tillman Jr."}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0081189/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069651/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0817023/","name":"Nicholas Sparks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0093271/","name":"Craig Bolotin"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La vérité
Prawda
La vérité
programme.desc:
La vérité: Directed by Hirokazu Koreeda. With Catherine Deneuve, Juliette Binoche, Ethan Hawke, Clémentine Grenier. A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8323120/","name":"La vérité","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJjMTVhMzMtOTQwNC00MzVkLWE3YjMtMjkwYTQ0YzEyMjBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8323120/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MartinHafer"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly okay....and not much more","reviewBody":"The Japanese filmmaker Hirokazu Koreeda is famous for focusing on some of the darker aspects of what it is to be Japanese. Some folks in his homeland (including some politicians) have criticized his films for exposing these problem....though many film buffs have loved these same films. It's surprising, then, when you watch "The Truth"....not just because it has an all French and American cast but because unlike his films such as "Like Father, Like Son" and "Shoplifters", he DOES pull his punches and more often than not avoids pushing boundaries! As a result, my daughter and I enjoyed the film but were also very disappointed.

The film stars Catherine Deneuve and Juliet Binoche as a self-absorbed mother and her frustrated daughter during a visit. And, amazingly, by the end of the story, nothing much happens....few sparks and the big confrontation scene you expect (because the daughter deservedly resents her mother) never really materialize and the mother somehow receives absolution though she did little to merit it....again, NOT like what you'd expect in a Hirokazu Koreeda movie.

Overall, the acting was good but the story itself a bit flat.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-10-11","keywords":"aging actress,acting,tortoise,dog,title is not in english","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1405009689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlmODk2MjktMWNmNC00M2U1LWJkOTUtMjUwNGJiMDVhZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlmODk2MjktMWNmNC00M2U1LWJkOTUtMjUwNGJiMDVhZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000160/","name":"Ethan Hawke"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466153/","name":"Hirokazu Koreeda"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029856/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0567389/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0705123/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466153/","name":"Hirokazu Koreeda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7408787/","name":"Ken Liu"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The New Mutants

The New Mutants
programme.desc: The New Mutants: Directed by Josh Boone. With Maisie Williams, Anya Taylor-Joy, Charlie Heaton, Alice Braga. Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4682266/","name":"The New Mutants","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ2NTdmNDgtMGIwMS00ODE2LTk5M2EtZGZhYzc4MWRlNTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc4MjczMTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five young mutants, just discovering their abilities while held in a secret facility against their will, fight to escape their past sins and save themselves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4682266/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sara-691"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"This movie desperately needed whatever they edited out.","reviewBody":"It was an OK movie all in all, but it could've been SO much better. I was personally stoked for a horror mutants movie, but this is as much horror as any other superhero movie (and less than some) so I must say I was very disappointed. The idea of was there and it could've been SO SO good but in the end, it wasn't...\n\nA thing that really distracted me was the actors weird accents.
