Throughout the summer, they become friends and rediscover how to enjoy life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10492998/","name":"Odio l'estate","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Q5ZDdmZWItMmNiYi00MjU5LThmOTAtZDU5N2ZhYmM1NDAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5OTQzNzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three families end up in the same rented house. Throughout the summer, they become friends and rediscover how to enjoy life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10492998/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"antoniotierno"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"excellent return","reviewBody":"A few years after the not so succesfull experiment of "Fuga da Reuma Park", after the celebrations for 25 years of activity together and after Aldo Baglio had started working alone (that seemed to be the beginning of the end of the Trio), here they go with a surprise new film, bringing the three guys back in the wake of a solid and mature comedy, which gets to speak to the hearts of old fans but maybe also able to conquer new ones. Certainly a bittersweet reflection on the passing of time and the risk of forgetting who we are, the story well written, funny and at times even moving, The film features three unexpectedly excellent first ladies, perfectly at ease in their meeting with Aldo Giovanni and Giacomo as well as the return of their historic director, who still knows how to make the most of their potential.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2309,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-01-30","keywords":"friend","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3128737305","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA5Y2E2MWUtMTdkYS00NjI3LTg0NzQtNTZmZmQwMjA0MDc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA5Y2E2MWUtMTdkYS00NjI3LTg0NzQtNTZmZmQwMjA0MDc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017623/","name":"Aldo Baglio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320495/","name":"Giovanni Storti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316034/","name":"Giacomo Poretti"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893111/","name":"Massimo Venier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043281/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254125/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3291357/","name":"Davide Lantieri"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1614496/","name":"Michele Pellegrini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893111/","name":"Massimo Venier"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Sting
Żądło
The Sting
programme.desc:
The Sting: Directed by George Roy Hill. With Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning. Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0070735/","name":"The Sting","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU3NjQ4YTMtZGJjOS00YTQ3LThmNmItMTI5MDE2ODI3NzY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUzOTY1NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0070735/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SilverDSam"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Comment on accuracy of the poker scene","reviewBody":"The Sting.

The Sting (1973) is one of everybody's favorite films. Director George Roy Hill took a page from his successful western, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, and teamed Paul Newman and Robert Redford once again, this time for an Academy Award four star movie about con men.

The intricate saga of The Sting is set in 1936 Chicago. It tells the story of grifters, Henry Gondorff and Johnny Hooker, played by Paul Newman and Robert Redford, respectively. They con the bad guy, Doyle Lonnegan, played by Robert Shaw. And at every turn, they con the audience as well.

The poker game is five card draw ('straight poker' in the film) and is set on a train traveling from New York to Chicago. Newman and Redford are on the train along with Shaw. The game has been set up by Shaw with the cooperation of the conductor. We don't know how Newman and Redford know exactly what day and what train Shaw is taking from New York to Chicago, but that is beside the purpose of our discussion. Shaw is a known card cheater, but Newman will prove to be a better one. Once again the holy game of poker will be sullied by the movies. This time, we'll love every minute of it.

Newman arranges to get himself invited to the poker game, through the conductor. He arrives sober, but apparently inebriated. It is the perfect act, consummately played in a boozy, needling performance by Paul Newman. 

Shaw's character is a known cold decker (a 'cold deck' is a deck introduced surreptitiously into the game with hands pre-arranged to break one of the players)' and Newman will have to play over the top of the cold deck when it is placed into the game.

One of the subtleties of the event is missed by most viewers. Newman must ready himself to overcome the cold deck. During the play of hands, we see Newman hold the cards close to his vest and, at least once, his cards disappear briefly below table level, out of sight, and back again. Newman knows Shaw cold decks middle cards against low cards, and so Newman is gathering and holding out jacks.

Newman immediately insults Shaw upon arrival and continues to heckle him throughout the play of the game, thus making sure Shaw will cold deck the game to teach the upstart drunk a lesson. When Shaw goes to the men's room to arrange to fix the cold deck, Newman knows the time has come. (In real life, cold decks were nearly always arranged in men's rooms. They should have had a dedicated stall marked 'coolers made here'.)

The game is three handed at this point. Shaw will bring the cold deck in when he cuts the cards for the dealer to his left. In filming the cold decking, the camera shows a pair of hands over the deck, then there's a cut in the continuity. Then the camera goes immediately back to the deck and we see the hands with the warm deck going to a handkerchief in Shaw's lap, leaving the cold deck on the table. I guess it would have been hard to do in one long shot.

The detail is interesting during the dealing of the cold deck. Newman is fussing with his cigar and poking behind his vest, implying something is happening. But we never see Newman with hand positions that could be holding out cards.

Newman is dealt trip threes and Shaw is dealt a pair of nines. The third player is the dealer and he is out of the hand. Newman draws two cards and gets his four threes with the six of hearts. Shaw draws three cards and gets his four nines with the ten of spades.

The planning of the arranged cold deck is well done and probable. After the cards are dealt, the cards on top of the deck are, in order, a three, the six of hearts, two nines and the ten of spades. It doesn't matter whether Newman draws one or two cards, he'll make his four threes and, in either case, Shaw, in drawing three cards, will make his four nines.

Now, here's the unlikely trick. Newman must change the hand with four threes for a hand with four jacks. It would be easiest to hold out an entire hand of four jacks and a fifth card and switch five card hands. But Newman switches only the four threes for the four jacks he's held out and he keeps the six of hearts. That is much harder to do and less likely would be the method chosen. Newman also takes the chance that Shaw won't have one of the legitimate jacks in his hand with the four nines, but in having to play over the top of the cold deck, that gamble is unavoidable.

Shaw's problem is that he can't call Newman for card manipulation because Shaw has an audience, the other players and the conductor. After Newman leaves the cabin, Shaw says to his lackey, 'What was I supposed to do? Call him for cheating better than me, in front of the others?'

Shaw was able to get $10,000 more in chips during a hand in a table stakes game. But that was okay with Newman.

The film shows Shaw wiping his face with a handkerchief during the play of the hand, implying he has disposed of the warm deck. However, we never see Newman clean up. So, when he leaves the poker cabin, one deck is short four jacks, the other deck has four extra jacks, and Newman still has four threes behind his vest somewhere. Whoever the conductor gives the decks to next, will have a few surprises.

Despite its faults, the poker scene from The Sting is the most fun filled, greatest directed, best acted, and most involved offering in cheating poker film history. And it was made over thirty years ago.

Silver Dollar Sam NothingWild.com"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":252642,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1973-12-25","keywords":"con,con man,illegal activity,playing golf,con artist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Sting","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2717122841","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5ZDllM2QtZjg2MS00NjA1LWE2ZTEtNmU2MTBkM2U2MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5ZDllM2QtZjg2MS00NjA1LWE2ZTEtNmU2MTBkM2U2MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000056/","name":"Paul Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000602/","name":"Robert Redford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001727/","name":"Robert Shaw"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001351/","name":"George Roy Hill"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019166/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911486/","name":"David S. Ward"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

I guess it would have been hard to do in one long shot.

The detail is interesting during the dealing of the cold deck. Newman is fussing with his cigar and poking behind his vest, implying something is happening. But we never see Newman with hand positions that could be holding out cards.

Newman is dealt trip threes and Shaw is dealt a pair of nines. The third player is the dealer and he is out of the hand. Newman draws two cards and gets his four threes with the six of hearts. Shaw draws three cards and gets his four nines with the ten of spades.

The planning of the arranged cold deck is well done and probable. After the cards are dealt, the cards on top of the deck are, in order, a three, the six of hearts, two nines and the ten of spades. It doesn't matter whether Newman draws one or two cards, he'll make his four threes and, in either case, Shaw, in drawing three cards, will make his four nines.

Now, here's the unlikely trick. Newman must change the hand with four threes for a hand with four jacks. It would be easiest to hold out an entire hand of four jacks and a fifth card and switch five card hands. But Newman switches only the four threes for the four jacks he's held out and he keeps the six of hearts. That is much harder to do and less likely would be the method chosen. Newman also takes the chance that Shaw won't have one of the legitimate jacks in his hand with the four nines, but in having to play over the top of the cold deck, that gamble is unavoidable.

Shaw's problem is that he can't call Newman for card manipulation because Shaw has an audience, the other players and the conductor. After Newman leaves the cabin, Shaw says to his lackey, 'What was I supposed to do? Call him for cheating better than me, in front of the others?'

Shaw was able to get $10,000 more in chips during a hand in a table stakes game. But that was okay with Newman.

The film shows Shaw wiping his face with a handkerchief during the play of the hand, implying he has disposed of the warm deck. However, we never see Newman clean up. So, when he leaves the poker cabin, one deck is short four jacks, the other deck has four extra jacks, and Newman still has four threes behind his vest somewhere. Whoever the conductor gives the decks to next, will have a few surprises.

Despite its faults, the poker scene from The Sting is the most fun filled, greatest directed, best acted, and most involved offering in cheating poker film history. And it was made over thirty years ago.

programme.desc:
Bombshell: Directed by Jay Roach. With Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, Margot Robbie, John Lithgow. A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6394270/","name":"Bombshell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjlhOWE3YjktY2MzOC00ZmQ1LWIwNjgtZmVhZmFjZGExMzgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6394270/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gradyharp"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"'He's about as flirty as the grizzly from The Revenant'","reviewBody":"It takes courage to place this true story before the public at this time of the political climate during debates by presidential candidates and retorts from the sitting president who is famous for his association with Fox News. Charles Randolph (The Big Short, and The Life of David Gale) has written a penetrating screenplay about the 2016 explosion when Fox News persona Roger Ailes was finally exposed for sexual harassment by some courageous women. Director Jay Roach (Trumbo, Blown Away, Austin Powers: International Man Of Mystery, etc) makes this story come vividly to life, unafraid to insert film clips of Donald Trump's appearances as the case unfolds, as well as including the lesbian relationships that give the story a new grounding.

The story of this Fox News scandal is true, so everyone knows the outline. As one distillation states, 'When Gretchen Carlson (Nicole Kidman) slaps Fox News founder Roger Ailes (John Lithgow) with a lawsuit alleging sexual harassment, not a soul could predict what would happen next. Her decision leads to Fox News correspondent Megyn Kelly (Charlize Theron) coming forward with her own story, as well as multiple other women, such as Kayla Pospisil (Margot Robbie), inciting a movement that reverberates around the world.'

The cast is outstanding: Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, and Margot Robbie each excel, but the other women in the film - Allison Janney, Connie Britton, Liv Hewson, Kate McKinnon, and Brigette Lundy-Paine - also impress. John Lithgow is very appropriately repugnant as Roger Ailes, as is Malcolm McDowell as Rupert Murdoch, and the clips of Giuliani, Trump et al. The tension never lets up as this scandal is related in fine form. Not only is the film excellent (though some may prefer the Showtime series THE LOUDEST VOICE account of the scandal), but also it offers award winning quality performances that allow the actors to step into different territories.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104813,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-20","keywords":"photograph,republican party,scandal,tv news,sexual harassment","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2331492121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bombshell - In theaters December 2019. programme.title: Masz na imie Justine
Masz na imię Justine
programme.desc:
Masz na imie Justine: Directed by Franco de Pena. With Anna Cieslak, Arno Frisch, Rafal Mackowiak, Mathieu Carrière. When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479257/","name":"Masz na imie Justine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ5MTQ0ODQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzkyODI5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479257/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ocosis"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark.","reviewBody":"Similar in tone to Lukas Moodysson's Lilja 4-Ever, Masz Na Imie Justine is another study of human trafficking, and the effects this horror has on the soul. Anna Cieslak gives a strong performance as the fated Mariola, a young Polish girl, who's leaves her home looking for a brighter future, but ends up being delivered into the hands of devils.

Cieslak's performance is the strongest part of the movie. As a film it's competently realised, but also feels a little vacuous, although that same feeling works well alongside Cieslak's character, whom understandably is losing her self to the tortures she is forced into.

As with Lilja 4-Ever, Masz Na Imie Justine is an important film, that warns us of the evil that man can inflict, and it is a horror that is sadly all too real.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-05-10","keywords":"pig,slaughterhouse,toasting with a drink,drinking vodka,male female relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1752088/","name":"Anna Cieslak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295823/","name":"Arno Frisch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533650/","name":"Rafal Mackowiak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143581/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121022/","name":"Chris Burdza"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1268993/","name":"Tomasz Kepski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Papusza
Papusza
programme.desc: Papusza: Directed by Joanna Kos-Krauze, Krzysztof Krauze. With Jowita Budnik, Zbigniew Walerys, Antoni Pawlicki, Artur Steranko. The rise and fall of the most distinguished Polish-Gypsy poetess Bronislawa Wajs, widely known as Papusza, and her relationship with her discoverer, writer Jerzy Ficowski." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2719094/","name":"Papusza","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODc0ODZlNTctZDRiNS00MDY1LTgzMzAtMjA1YzIyN2U5ZGEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzMzMjU5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The rise and fall of the most distinguished Polish-Gypsy poetess Bronislawa Wajs, widely known as Papusza, and her relationship with her discoverer, writer Jerzy Ficowski.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2719094/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"davidy46"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the most beautiful and moving films I've ever seen","reviewBody":"Can't quite understand how this film got overlooked for an Oscar. It got a rave review in a Danish newspaper when it was doing the rounds here in March 2015, so my wife and I went to see it. Just beautifully filmed and acted - a very moving portrait of a people whom I knew nothing about previously. When I came out, I was on the verge of revising my choice of Fanny and Alexander as my favourite film; I was so in awe of what I had just seen. Sadly, Krzysztof Krauze, the co-director, died at Christmas 2014. I have been in touch with the Polish Film Institute to see if a DVD with English sub-titles is available, but it isn't yet, despite it being shown at the London Film Festival. Let's hope something is done about that - I'd buy several copies as gifts for friends. If you get a chance to see it, don't miss it. "Ida" deservedly got a lot of good reviews and even the Oscar for Best Foreign Film. This one is much better.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1296,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-11-15","keywords":"character name as title,nickname as title,papusza character,poetess,title directed by female","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591858/","name":"Jowita Budnik"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1138580/","name":"Zbigniew Walerys"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2252397/","name":"Antoni Pawlicki"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732806/","name":"Joanna Kos-Krauze"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470377/","name":"Krzysztof Krauze"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732806/","name":"Joanna Kos-Krauze"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470377/","name":"Krzysztof Krauze"}],"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2719094, Title: Papusza, --- Description: Papusza: Directed by Joanna Kos-Krauze, Krzysztof Krauze. With Jowita Budnik, Zbigniew Walerys, Antoni Pawlicki, Artur Steranko. The rise and fall of the most distinguished Polish-Gypsy poetess Bronislawa Wajs, widely known as Papusza, and her relationship with her discoverer, writer Jerzy Ficowski." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2719094/","name":"Papusza","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODc0ODZlNTctZDRiNS00MDY1LTgzMzAtMjA1YzIyN2U5ZGEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzMzMjU5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The rise and fall of the most distinguished Polish-Gypsy poetess Bronislawa Wajs, widely known as Papusza, and her relationship with her discoverer, writer Jerzy Ficowski.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2719094/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"davidy46","dateCreated":"2015-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the most beautiful and moving films I've ever seen","reviewBody":"Can't quite understand how this film got overlooked for an Oscar. It got a rave review in a Danish newspaper when it was doing the rounds here in March 2015, so my wife and I went to see it. Just beautifully filmed and acted - a very moving portrait of a people whom I knew nothing about previously. When I came out, I was on the verge of revising my choice of Fanny and Alexander as my favourite film; I was so in awe of what I had just seen. Sadly, Krzysztof Krauze, the co-director, died at Christmas 2014. I have been in touch with the Polish Film Institute to see if a DVD with English sub-titles is available, but it isn't yet, despite it being shown at the London Film Festival. Let's hope something is done about that - I'd buy several copies as gifts for friends. If you get a chance to see it, don't miss it. "Ida" deservedly got a lot of good reviews and even the Oscar for Best Foreign Film. This one is much better.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1296,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"contentRating":"G","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-11-15","keywords":"character name as title,nickname as title,papusza character,poetess,title directed by female","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591858/","name":"Jowita Budnik","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1138580/","name":"Zbigniew Walerys","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2252397/","name":"Antoni Pawlicki"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732806/","name":"Joanna Kos-Krauze","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470377/","name":"Krzysztof Krauze"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732806/","name":"Joanna Kos-Krauze","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470377/","name":"Krzysztof Krauze"],"duration":"PT2H11M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: "Zasada przyjemności" - making of
programme.desc: Czasy lockdownu. Dwaj znający się z planu serialu "Dobry omen" aktorzy, David Tennant i Michael Sheen, prowadzą przez Zooma próby do przedstawienia "Sześciu postaci w poszukiwaniu autora". Wcielający się w poddane karykaturze wersje samych siebie artyści napotykają coraz to nowe przeszkody. Jedną z trudności jest ogromny egocentryzm obu panów.

programme.title: Moda na "Króla"
programme.desc: Dokument zdradza kulisy wyjątkowego pomysłu łączącego świat mody i filmu. Widzowie poznają projektantów oraz śledzą etapy powstawania kolekcji, która inspirowana jest duchem epoki z serialowej superprodukcji.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Wysoki Pressing
programme.desc: Prowadzony w lekkiej formule telewizji śniadaniowej program poświęcony piłce nożnej. Gospodarz wraz z gośćmi omówi najważniejsze boiskowe wydarzenia, nie zabraknie też wnikliwych analiz i gorących dyskusji. Prowadzącymi na zmianę będą Daria Kabała-Malarz i Michał Kołodziejczyk.

programme.title: Turbokozak Extra
programme.desc: Bartosz Ignacik i Grzegorz Jędrzejewski sprawdzają, jak ludzie związani z szeroko pojętym światem sportu poradzą sobie na boisku. Zaproszeni goście muszą wykonać różne piłkarskie zadania. Za ich wykonanie otrzymują punkty, które zaliczane są do klasyfikacji danego sezonu programu.

programme.title: Turbokozak
programme.desc: Bartosz Ignacik i Grzegorz Jędrzejewski w zabawnym teście sprawdzają umiejętności piłkarskie zawodników z Ekstraklasy. Czasem w programie pojawiają się reprezentanci innych dyscyplin i znane osoby.

credits.actor: Karolina Kuszewska-Łukasik, Sasha Sidorenko, Sylwia Zaczkiewicz, Dominika Rembelska, Gabriela Kuzawińska, Ewa Piątkowska, Joanna Jędrzejczyk, Sylwia Kusiak, Magdalena Loska
Karolina Kuszewska-Łukasik, Sasha Sidorenko, Sylwia Zaczkiewicz, Dominika Rembelska, Gabriela Kuzawińska, Ewa Piątkowska, Joanna Jędrzejczyk, Sylwia Kusiak, Magdalena Loska

programme.title: 365 obiadów Mariety Mareckiej 2
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu Marieta Marecka w każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy nowe, często zaskakujące potrawy, które złożą się w gotowy plan na obiad dla całej rodziny. Udzieli też wielu cennych wskazówek.

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek
programme.desc: Popularna blogerka Marta Dymek w każdym odcinku próbuje przekonać zaproszonego gościa do kuchni wegetariańskiej. Prowadząca pokaże, jak zastąpić potrawy mięsne ich jarskimi wariacjami.

programme.title: Kucharskiego pomysł na kuchnię
programme.desc: Piotr Kucharski pokaże widzom, jak przełamać kulinarną rutynę i sprawić, by gotowanie było przyjemne, a jego efekt - smaczny.

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 4
programme.desc: Wiesiek Skiba pomaga ludziom, którzy stali się ofiarami nierzetelnych firm remontowych. Specjalista naprawi rozmaite usterki zgłoszone przez widzów. Udowodni też, że wiele drobnych remontów w kuchni, łazience, salonie czy na tarasie można zrobić samodzielnie.

programme.title: Na cenzurowanym
Master of the Classe
programme.desc: Berry (Sébastien Chassagne) ma 35 lat i dopiero niedawno dostał pracę jako stażysta w gimnazjum. Jego marzenie o stabilnym zatrudnieniu zostaje poddane próbie. Pewnego dnia ma się odbyć inspekcja jego lekcji, której wynik zadecyduje o tym, czy mężczyzna zdobędzie stałą posadę.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Kolej na miłość
programme.desc: Instruktor survivalu Łukasz Tulej odwiedza ciekawe rejony Polski, często oddalone od cywilizacji. Musi znaleźć miejsce odpowiednie do biwakowania, a także przygotować pożywny posiłek. Prowadzący prezentuje cenne dla turystów porady, które mogą okazać się niezastąpione w różnych sytuacjach.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga francuska - podsumowanie sezonu 2020/2021
programme.desc: Instruktor survivalu Łukasz Tulej odwiedza ciekawe rejony Polski, często oddalone od cywilizacji. Musi znaleźć miejsce odpowiednie do biwakowania, a także przygotować pożywny posiłek. programme.title: 365 obiadów Mariety Mareckiej 2
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu Marieta Marecka w każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy nowe, często zaskakujące potrawy, które złożą się w gotowy plan na obiad dla całej rodziny. Udzieli też wielu cennych wskazówek.

programme.title: Nie bój ryby!
programme.desc: Bartosz Lisek pracował jako kucharz okrętowy. Chcąc urozmaicić żeglarską dietę, składającą się głównie z makaronu i mielonki, odwiedzał targi w każdym porcie. Kupował tam świeże ryby i różnorodne owoce morza. Teraz dzieli się przepisami, nad którymi pracował przez lata. Podpowiada też, które ryby są najzdrowsze. W każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy smakowite propozycje - przystawkę, zupę i drugie danie.

programme.title: First Ladies
Pierwsze damy
First Ladies
programme.desc: First Ladies: With Robin Wright, Kati Marton, Kate Andersen Brower, Karen Tumulty. The personal and political lives of First Ladies from throughout history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10896026/","name":"First Ladies","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUzY2QyZmItY2IyYi00NjUzLWJkOTMtNzdjOTExNjQyYjdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The personal and political lives of First Ladies from throughout history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10896026/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kbajaj-32784"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"This was Amazing!!","reviewBody":"Honestly loved it. Usually I do things while I'm watching tv but on the first episode I was hooked, my eyes glued to the screen and I couldn't stop. And I even watched the commercials it came with since I watched it on demand! And I wasn't irritated I was just anticipating the next episode. The first episode was just great, relatable and made me instantly want to buy her biography or memoir. Can't wait for more. History like this just fascinates me. I even read books on women hero's of World War Two because I feel like they are so underrepresented but are so inspiring and important in their own way. So this series was exactly what I needed right now.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":309,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Documentary","Biography"],"datePublished":"2020-10-04","keywords":"first lady of the united states of america,u.s. president,politician's wife,the white house,american politics","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000705/","name":"Robin Wright"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0617356/","name":"Kati Marton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7248272/","name":"Kate Andersen Brower"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0112302/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165168/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi586203417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQxMmFmMDctMjlmNy00ZTVmLWFiODUtZjY5NmM3MDcwMmY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQxMmFmMDctMjlmNy00ZTVmLWFiODUtZjY5NmM3MDcwMmY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: O co biega?
programme.desc: W magazynie nowinki oraz praktyczne porady dla osób, które uprawiają bieganie rekreacyjnie, półprofesjonalnie, zawodowo lub dopiero zaczynają. Gospodarz programu Marcin Rosłoń wraz z ekspertami będzie podpowiadał, jak przygotować się do biegania amatorskiego i zawodowego, jak dobrać odpowiedni sprzęt lub przygotować się do maratonu. W programie nie zabraknie również ciekawostek, rozmów ze sportowcami i osobami z show-biznesu, które opowiedzą o swojej pasji do biegania.

programme.title: Fit for a Prince
Fit for a Prince
programme.desc:
Fit for a Prince: Directed by Marita Grabiak. With Jonathan Keltz, Natalie Hall, Melinda Michael, Tanya Clarke. A fashion designer is hired to dress ladies of a wealthy family which are hosting an upcoming charity ball. Cindy's life takes an unexpected turn when Prince Ronan becomes smitten with her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt14039028/","name":"Fit for a Prince","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGRmYjFiOTQtOWY3MS00OTdlLTk4ZmItMzY0MjdhMTczZjQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjAwNzczNTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fashion designer is hired to dress ladies of a wealthy family which are hosting an upcoming charity ball. Cindy's life takes an unexpected turn when Prince Ronan becomes smitten with her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt14039028/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cgvsluis"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"If I can restore things with my hands I am sure I can be of some help.","reviewBody":"Natalie Hall who plays Cindy is delightful! But what I truly enjoyed about this film is how the prince sees through the facade and figures out very quickly who the real designer is behind Rebecca Roslyn's designs. Not only does he obtain this information quickly, but he is not easily fooled in to thinking otherwise...and he is incredible supportive of someone who he views as an incredibly talented, hard working, under appreciated designer.

When his group of friends intentionally trick Cindy in to underdressing for an event, the prince goes out of his way to try to make her feel comfortable by also dressing down. This isn't the only way he tries to build her up and make her feel comfortable...at one point in spite not being able to sew, he helps Cindy remake dresses for the ball under an extreme time crunch. He is really beyond too impossible to be true! But that is why we watch Hallmark, isn't it? Therefore Prince Ronan is perfect, as ordered!

I appreciated how the romantic rival, after initially doing something mean spirited, turns a new leaf and champions her rival before the last five minutes of the film where they usually cede there defeat. I also really appreciated the actress who was the grandmother (I think) who was real and honest...and telling like it was from the onset.

"Spontaneous, in the moment, out of character."

As mentioned, Natalie Hall is delightful and you should watch this film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":688,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-03-06","keywords":"pennsylvania,fashion designer,seamstress,prince,eligible bachelor","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1947831/","name":"Jonathan Keltz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2834250/","name":"Natalie Hall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5711531/","name":"Melinda Michael"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0333239/","name":"Marita Grabiak"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197380/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12070716/","name":"T. Booker James"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

Ida
programme.desc:
The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AvidClimber"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stunning and unpretentious","reviewBody":"The East is the kind of movie that makes you want to join the fight, raise your voice and be heard.

The good. Extremely immersive. A incredible story with lots of emotions, conflicts, opposing moralities, and a stupefying journey. It is gripping and you will not be left unmoved.

The actors. Brit Marling and Ellen Page both give us a great performance. I was disappointed by Alexander Skarsgård, I thought that he was the weak player of the cast. The rest of the cell was pretty solid: Toby Kebbell, Shiloh Fernandez, Aldis Hodge, and Danielle Macdonald. And I should mention the nice work done by Patricia Clarkson as the director of the private security firm.

The bad. The ending is rushed. It feels like there was missing material at the end of filming and they couldn't go back to get what they needed and had to edit it with what they had.

The ugly. Nothing.

The result. A must see for anyone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,nude swimming,male nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. programme.title: Trzy i pół godziny
programme.desc: Monachium, 13 sierpnia 1961 roku. Pasażerowie pociągu do Berlina Wschodniego dowiadują się o budowie muru dzielącego miasto. Do granicy dotrą za trzy i pół godziny. W tym czasie muszą podjąć decyzję, czy wysiąść, czy jechać dalej. Przed trudnym wyborem staje m.in. Marlis podróżująca z mężem Gerdem i dzieckiem.

programme.title: One Fine Day
Szczęśliwy dzień
One Fine Day
programme.desc:
One Fine Day: Directed by Michael Hoffman. With Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman, Alex D. Linz. The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117247/","name":"One Fine Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdhMjgxODQtZjNhNS00YjZiLWFmYTAtODZmM2RhM2M3YmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117247/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philipdavies"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment ...","reviewBody":"The headlong screwball comedy of this breakneck romance of two stressed-out single parents is a delight from beginning to end. It has scenes as quick witted - and often as wackily off-kilter! - as the adults must be just in order to survive their average day. Stir love into this mess of two increasingly desparate modern lives and you get a miraculous souffle of a film, at once sharp and sweet.

No scene is laboured, no point is telegraphed, and - phenomenally for a modern American film - neither kids nor kittens are allowed to smother the audience in the nauseous layers of cutesiness that are usually applied. The scene with the analyst, where Clooney must obscure his account of his sex-life in an ever-more-surrealistic periphrasis involving iced cakes and fish, since his little daughter has to accompany him into the presumably crecheless analyst's surgery, and her dad is embarassed to expose her to such adult matters as he is obliged to reveal during the session, is a scene which is a model of intelligent and stylish comedy writing. The dialogue of both himself and his analyst finally founders on the increasingly strained comparisons and metaphors being attempted. The analyst begins to construct an alarmingly kinky lifestyle for his client out of what he takes to be Freudian suggestions - but which are, as noted, merely the product of old-fashioned seemliness - whereupon Clooney is forced to bring the whole towering edifice back down to earth when his version of the morning's business with the goldfish gets mixed up in the heady brew of symbolism: 'No. I mean fish. You know - 'Fish' fish?'

The humour is all good, never strained, and beautifully played by all the principals, including the wonderfully un-sentimentalised children. The transformation, stage-by-stage, of the harsh mutual competition and resentment that exists at first between these harassed adults, into an exhausted truce, by way of barely-restrained irritation, grudging gratitude, reluctant respect, and growing affection, is handled with considerable dramatic finesse throughout.

To produce the unlikely union of such an ill-assorted pair under such utterly unpropitious and unromantic circumstances is a comedic challenge of considerable proportions, and the makers of this film do an excellent job to bring it off at all. The spirits of Grant and Hepburn - even Beatrice and Benedict - are not too far away.

The only disappointment is to see how many people in the audience have gone home just as sour as when they arrived, judging from some of the comments here. But then, love curdles in any mean-spirited breast.

 One particularly admires the fact that, at its conclusion, the film's romantic clincher - when the tired-out couple have to settle for just falling asleep together, despite their by now clearly desparate need for each other, - insists upon the importance of exactly this: Love, rather than merely lust, as the basis for an adult relationship.

Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment. IMDb data; ttnr: 0117247, Title: One Fine Day, --- Description: One Fine Day: Directed by Michael Hoffman. With Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman, Alex D. Linz. The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117247/","name":"One Fine Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdhMjgxODQtZjNhNS00YjZiLWFmYTAtODZmM2RhM2M3YmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117247/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"philipdavies","dateCreated":"2003-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment ...","reviewBody":"The headlong screwball comedy of this breakneck romance of two stressed-out single parents is a delight from beginning to end. It has scenes as quick witted - and often as wackily off-kilter! - as the adults must be just in order to survive their average day. Stir love into this mess of two increasingly desparate modern lives and you get a miraculous souffle of a film, at once sharp and sweet.

No scene is laboured, no point is telegraphed, and - phenomenally for a modern American film - neither kids nor kittens are allowed to smother the audience in the nauseous layers of cutesiness that are usually applied. The scene with the analyst, where Clooney must obscure his account of his sex-life in an ever-more-surrealistic periphrasis involving iced cakes and fish, since his little daughter has to accompany him into the presumably crecheless analyst's surgery, and her dad is embarassed to expose her to such adult matters as he is obliged to reveal during the session, is a scene which is a model of intelligent and stylish comedy writing. The dialogue of both himself and his analyst finally founders on the increasingly strained comparisons and metaphors being attempted. The analyst begins to construct an alarmingly kinky lifestyle for his client out of what he takes to be Freudian suggestions - but which are, as noted, merely the product of old-fashioned seemliness - whereupon Clooney is forced to bring the whole towering edifice back down to earth when his version of the morning's business with the goldfish gets mixed up in the heady brew of symbolism: 'No. I mean fish. You know - 'Fish' fish?'

The humour is all good, never strained, and beautifully played by all the principals, including the wonderfully un-sentimentalised children. The transformation, stage-by-stage, of the harsh mutual competition and resentment that exists at first between these harassed adults, into an exhausted truce, by way of barely-restrained irritation, grudging gratitude, reluctant respect, and growing affection, is handled with considerable dramatic finesse throughout.

To produce the unlikely union of such an ill-assorted pair under such utterly unpropitious and unromantic circumstances is a comedic challenge of considerable proportions, and the makers of this film do an excellent job to bring it off at all. The spirits of Grant and Hepburn - even Beatrice and Benedict - are not too far away.

The only disappointment is to see how many people in the audience have gone home just as sour as when they arrived, judging from some of the comments here. But then, love curdles in any mean-spirited breast.

 One particularly admires the fact that, at its conclusion, the film's romantic clincher - when the tired-out couple have to settle for just falling asleep together, despite their by now clearly desparate need for each other, - insists upon the importance of exactly this: Love, rather than merely lust, as the basis for an adult relationship.

Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment. It makes a pleasant and wholesome change from the usual fare of adolescent dreams.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45255,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1996-12-20","keywords":"architect,united states,usa,mother son relationship,friendship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"One Fine Day","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3298689305","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926165/","name":"Mae Whitman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001355/","name":"Michael Hoffman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002149/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0195234/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0783559/","name":"Terrel Seltzer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800124/","name":"Ellen Simon"],"duration":"PT1H48M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Stand In
Dublerka
The Stand-In
programme.desc: The Stand In: Directed by Jamie Babbit. With Drew Barrymore, Sarah Jes Austell, Michael Zegen, T.J. Miller. THE STAND-IN is the story of a disaffected comedy actress and her ambitious stand-in trading places." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7970348/","name":"The Stand In","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjE0YWZjZTItMmUwYy00OGNlLWJkZmItZDk2YWJjZmViOTBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY1MTg4Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"THE STAND-IN is the story of a disaffected comedy actress and her ambitious stand-in trading places.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7970348/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mauricioalexisveliz"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not a comedy but it's a good movie!","reviewBody":"Ok, I understand the bad reviews because the movie was presented as a comedy, but it's not a comedy at all. It's more of a drama / thriller movie and within those genres it works very well. Drew Barrymore did an excellent job, she played two roles, this depressed, overwhelmed woman with severe problems and on the other hand there is this other character, who at first seems to be a happy girl with problems but innocent, although little by little she is showing her true essence. So if you are going to see this movie, I recommend you not to see it as a comedy, because you will not find jokes, funny scenes, etc. See this movie for what it is, a drama with touches of thriller. And I repeat, Drew Barrymore really did an excellent job here!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2980,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-12-11","keywords":"actress","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3136274713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhmMGVhMzktMjQwNC00YWIyLWI0ZWEtMzU0ODQzNjcwOWU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhmMGVhMzktMjQwNC00YWIyLWI0ZWEtMzU0ODQzNjcwOWU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When ordered to serve a year in rehab, actress Candy (Drew Barrymore) hires her on set stand-in to take her place. The unassuming woman flips the script and steals her identity, career and boyfriend in this hilarious comedy about trading places."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000106/","name":"Drew Barrymore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5304955/","name":"Sarah Jes Austell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1652433/","name":"Michael Zegen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0044803/","name":"Jamie Babbit"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0360871/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0148534/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0721934/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1095060/","name":"Sam Bain"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jestem REN
Jestem REN
programme.desc: Jestem REN: Directed by Patricia Ryczko. With Marta Król, Marcin Sztabinski, Marieta Zukowska, Janusz Chabior. We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that her android self is her own fantasy. She begins to cooperate with the therapy, realizing she will be able to return to her family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11067160/","name":"Jestem REN","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFiNDYxZDQtYzZjOC00NmU5LTllYjEtZjc4MWFhZGRhZTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzUwOTc4NjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that h","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11067160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fxflinn"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thought provoking parable of mental illness","reviewBody":"Caught this at the Boston Science Fiction Film Festival in Feb 2020. It's a tidy, well made film that draws you into a family battling the mental illness of the mother, who believes she is a sentient android who has malfunctioned. But maybe she is a human who has constructed an elaborate backstory to hide from the pain of being a person who cannot love and who cannot stop beating her on-the-cusp of manhood son. The material clues suggest we are in our time, not some future echoing the television series "Humans," but we are looking at the world through the eyes of the narrator, the mother, and she sees clues about her android origin everywhere. By the time the movie reaches its conclusion, you've been drawn into the madness, the uncertainty of what is human, what is programming, and profound discomfort for the mom and her interior life. The dedication at the end of the film makes it clear the filmmaker wanted to share his experience with his mother and her struggle. He succeeded. The intimate cinematography is a case study in how closeups and lighting can draw an audience into the interior life of the characters. The actors all do a fine job, particularly Marta Krol in the role of the mother and Marieta Zukowska as her peer, counterpart, alter ego or therapist -- when you are in psychosis, those around you play many roles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":74,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-03-27","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2067989/","name":"Marta Król"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2029225/","name":"Marcin Sztabinski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2346424/","name":"Marieta Zukowska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0734708/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0767135/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0778711/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Marek Edelman... i była miłość w getcie
programme.desc: Zmarły w 2009 roku Marek Edelman był ostatnim przywódcą powstania w getcie warszawskim. Przed swoją śmiercią odpowiedział na pytanie, czy w getcie była miłość i jak ona się przejawiała. Film jest odpowiedzią na książkę Marka Edelmana i Pauli Sawickiej o tym samym tytule, która zawiera wspomnienia mężczyzny. Przy jego scenariuszu współpracowała Agnieszka Holland, a jego fabularyzowane sceny współreżyserował Andrzej Wajda.

Volcano

Polański, Horowitz. Hometown
programme.desc: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto: Directed by Mateusz Kudla, Anna Kokoszka-Romer. With Roman Polanski, Ryszard Horowitz, Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska, Stanislaw Buchala. Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8546414/","name":"Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg0NmQ3NmEtY2NkOC00ZmI2LTg3YmUtNTc2MGEwNWQ2OWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk5MjEzMTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8546414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"belenus-133-722656"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very moving true strory.","reviewBody":"This is a beautiful documentary. It takes you right into the heart of the darkest period in the 20th century, right into the heart of a Holocaust - Krakow in Poland, where the famous Plaszow ghetto was located and where the trains were loaded for Auschwitz. It's also a very intimate and moving portrait of a true friendship between two great artists. We get to see incredible suffering but also have a chance to witness a fantastic sense of humour, which obviously is the best way to deal with such sad memories. We can also now understand why Polanski refused to film "The Shindler's List" and instead filmed "The Pianist". We should be very grateful to film authors. PS - People who give this film a low rating obviously have not seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2021-08-20","keywords":"childhood","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1058543/","name":"Ryszard Horowitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7061785/","name":"Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0701909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Pianist
Pianista
The Pianist
programme.desc:
The Pianist: Directed by Roman Polanski. With Adrien Brody, Emilia Fox, Michal Zebrowski, Ed Stoppard. A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253474/","name":"The Pianist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRiZDIxZjktMTA1NC00MDQ2LWEzMjUtMTliZmY3NjQ3ODJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ashcoounter"},"dateCreated":"2003-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliantly Narrated, Visually Stunning!","reviewBody":"Polanski has depicted the gory details of the holocaust without much restraint. But, the most wonderful aspect of the film is that the director has not lost focus of his story and instead of focusing too much on the holocaust horror he has weaved the true-life narrative of survival around devillish happenings.

Every single act of escapade Szpilman goes through is depicted like a drop of water on a barren desert. However, the Oasis in the driest desert comes in the end and it is here that Polanski captures the essence of human emotion. I had this very strong urge of jumping into the theater screen and magically adopting a character in the movie and doing something about the helplesness portrayed so convincingly.

Overall, Polanski has given a stunning visual narrative of the cold war. Survival indeed is a privilege though it is taken for granted today. Performances by Brody, Kretschmann deserve applause.

Pawel Edelman's camera work is moving and he has brilliantly captured the dark sadness in the visual canvas in an effective way. The lighting is amazing. Pre-dawn shooting schedule could have helped a great deal.

Hervé de Luze's editing work has ensured that the narrative does not slip away from focus. Most notable is the scene where the human bodies are lit on fire and the camera raises to show the smoke. The darkness of the smoke is enhanced and is used effectively to fade the scene out.

The scene where Brody's fingers move as he rests his hands on the bars of the tram handle only goes to show the brilliance of Polanski as a film-maker.

Great film that will be in the running for this year's Oscars. I will give it a 9 Out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":777302,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Biography","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"pianist,holocaust,survival,nazi occupied poland,person in a wheelchair falls from height","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Pianist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi988938521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004778/","name":"Adrien Brody"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470981/","name":"Thomas Kretschmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277975/","name":"Frank Finlay"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024473/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030304/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367838/","name":"Ronald Harwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0844262/","name":"Wladyslaw Szpilman"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0253474, Title: The Pianist, --- Description: The Pianist: Directed by Roman Polanski. With Adrien Brody, Emilia Fox, Michal Zebrowski, Ed Stoppard. A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253474/","name":"The Pianist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRiZDIxZjktMTA1NC00MDQ2LWEzMjUtMTliZmY3NjQ3ODJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253474/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ashcoounter","dateCreated":"2003-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliantly Narrated, Visually Stunning!","reviewBody":"Polanski has depicted the gory details of the holocaust without much restraint. But, the most wonderful aspect of the film is that the director has not lost focus of his story and instead of focusing too much on the holocaust horror he has weaved the true-life narrative of survival around devillish happenings.

Every single act of escapade Szpilman goes through is depicted like a drop of water on a barren desert. However, the Oasis in the driest desert comes in the end and it is here that Polanski captures the essence of human emotion. I had this very strong urge of jumping into the theater screen and magically adopting a character in the movie and doing something about the helplesness portrayed so convincingly.

Overall, Polanski has given a stunning visual narrative of the cold war. Survival indeed is a privilege though it is taken for granted today. Performances by Brody, Kretschmann deserve applause.

Pawel Edelman's camera work is moving and he has brilliantly captured the dark sadness in the visual canvas in an effective way. The lighting is amazing. Pre-dawn shooting schedule could have helped a great deal.

Hervé de Luze's editing work has ensured that the narrative does not slip away from focus. Most notable is the scene where the human bodies are lit on fire and the camera raises to show the smoke. The darkness of the smoke is enhanced and is used effectively to fade the scene out.

The scene where Brody's fingers move as he rests his hands on the bars of the tram handle only goes to show the brilliance of Polanski as a film-maker.

Great film that will be in the running for this year's Oscars. programme.title: Life in a Year
Rok na całe życie
Life In A Year
programme.desc:
Life in a Year: Directed by Mitja Okorn. With Jaden Smith, Cara Delevingne, Cuba Gooding Jr., Chris D'Elia. The movie follows 17-year-old Daryn who finds out that his girlfriend is dying. He sets out to give her an entire life in the last year she has left." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6598238/","name":"Life in a Year","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTNiY2Y4MjMtM2MyMi00ODYxLTk4N2MtNjhkYjVkODFjNmRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDg0MDgxNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The movie follows 17-year-old Daryn who finds out that his girlfriend is dying. He sets out to give her an entire life in the last year she has left.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6598238/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Retread teen issues, see it if it is free.","reviewBody":"Beware, there are several "10" reviews by people who just recently have established their accounts, most likely studio shills to get the rating up. This is becoming more and more routine on the IMDb. You'd best ignore them.

My greatest disappointment with this film is casting Jaden Smith as the boyfriend. If you do a search on the terms "can't act" you might well get a photo of Jaden Smith. He drags the movie down.

A few years ago he was featured in "After Earth" with his dad, on that role I wrote, "This is a very plain story, and relies on young Jaden Smith to convince us he can carry an action movie. He showed us he can't. He is not a good actor, and he enunciates so poorly that we often had difficulty even understanding what he said."

Other than that it is a decent story, although told many times before, and Cara Delevingne is really good in a challenging role. See the movie if you will, just don't expect too much. It is available FREE on Amazon so you are only out a bit of your time."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7393,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-12-16","keywords":"girlfriend,blue green hair,pink hair","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi456704281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc3YmViMGYtYjgyNi00NDg2LTk2MTEtNDVmOTI4ODQ2MzRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc3YmViMGYtYjgyNi00NDg2LTk2MTEtNDVmOTI4ODQ2MzRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"The movie follows 17-year-old Daryn who finds out that his girlfriend is dying. programme.desc: Triumph: Directed by Brett Leonard. With RJ Mitte, Johnathon Schaech, Terrence Howard, Colton Haynes. programme.title: The Curse of La Llorona
Płacząca kobieta
La Llorona
programme.desc:
The Curse of La Llorona: Directed by Michael Chaves. With Linda Cardellini, Roman Christou, Jaynee-Lynne Kinchen, Raymond Cruz. Ignoring the eerie warning of a troubled mother suspected of child endangerment, a social worker and her own small kids are soon drawn into a frightening supernatural realm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4913966/","name":"The Curse of La Llorona","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjU4NjU4ZDktOTg2Ny00MWI2LThiMTAtMGFkZGE1MWI5MzhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODQxMTI4MjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ignoring the eerie warning of a troubled mother suspected of child endangerment, a social worker and her own small kids are soon drawn into a frightening supernatural realm.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4913966/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"embracing_silence"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could have been good","reviewBody":"The legend of La Llorona is a very interesting story that had potential to become a good movie. Unfortunately, this one suffered from showing the monster too much.

The plot wasn't bad. It would have been more interesting if they showed more of how the legend started, but they had a good idea to go with. What really didn't work for this movie was showing La Llorona too many times, to the point that she wasn't scary. What's always creepy in movies like this is not being able to see their face until the very end, which they had a perfect scene to show her, but by then it was too late.

If you like the Conjuring universe/horror movies, it's a fun watch, just don't expect anything special.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":46506,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-04-19","keywords":"ghost,widow,spin off,folklore,social worker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3663903257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjYwZTJiYTktM2E0NC00ZjJjLWFmYmYtYjZmM2ZlOTdjNzI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjYwZTJiYTktM2E0NC00ZjJjLWFmYmYtYjZmM2ZlOTdjNzI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ignoring the eerie warning of a troubled mother suspected of child endangerment, a social worker and her own children are drawn into a frightening supernatural realm."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004802/","name":"Linda Cardellini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190441/","name":"Raymond Cruz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0892383/","name":"Patricia Velasquez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1980431/","name":"Michael Chaves"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0504531/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5657522/","name":"Mikki Daughtry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3037068/","name":"Tobias Iaconis"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fågelfångarens Son
Syn ptasznika
Fågelfångarens Son
programme.desc: Fågelfångarens Son: Directed by Richard Hobert. With Rudi Køhnke, Vígdis Eliesersdóttir Hentze Bjørck, Livia Millhagen, Hedda Rehnberg. Plot Summary It's the late 1800's and the birdcatcher Esmar and his wife Johanna are trying to survive on the harsh dramatic cliffs of the Faroe Islands. Local law dictates that unless they have a son, an heir to the hold on their land, they will be evicted. When Johanna gives birth to their third daughter, with time on the lease running out, they become desperate. A friend, innkeeper Livia, suggests that the only way for Johanna to have a son might be to be impregnated by another man. It's unthinkable, but they are pushed to the brink. When they employ Livia's lover, the "French Captain" to do the deed, none of. them can understand the ultimate consequences of their choices." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7552784/","name":"Fågelfångarens Son","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmNiN2MzMDgtMWYyNy00NmNmLWFhYzQtNzFlYzgwMzRhMTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzAzMTAyNjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Plot Summary It's the late 1800's and the birdcatcher Esmar and his wife Johanna are trying to survive on the harsh dramatic cliffs of the Faroe Islands. IMDb data; ttnr: 7552784, Title: Fågelfångarens Son, --- Description: Fågelfångarens Son: Directed by Richard Hobert. With Rudi Køhnke, Vígdis Eliesersdóttir Hentze Bjørck, Livia Millhagen, Hedda Rehnberg. Plot Summary It's the late 1800's and the birdcatcher Esmar and his wife Johanna are trying to survive on the harsh dramatic cliffs of the Faroe Islands. Local law dictates that unless they have a son, an heir to the hold on their land, they will be evicted. When Johanna gives birth to their third daughter, with time on the lease running out, they become desperate. A friend, innkeeper Livia, suggests that the only way for Johanna to have a son might be to be impregnated by another man. It's unthinkable, but they are pushed to the brink. When they employ Livia's lover, the "French Captain" to do the deed, none of. them can understand the ultimate consequences of their choices." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7552784/","name":"Fågelfångarens Son","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmNiN2MzMDgtMWYyNy00NmNmLWFhYzQtNzFlYzgwMzRhMTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzAzMTAyNjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Plot Summary It's the late 1800's and the birdcatcher Esmar and his wife Johanna are trying to survive on the harsh dramatic cliffs of the Faroe Islands.
